KWdKEHxiW7zo--ycCW2Kig.text: Came across this restaurant while searching for brunch spots in Las Vegas. I am a huge foodie and I love when restaurants are creative with their dishes because it shows their TLC. Walked in with a group of eleven and were sat promptly. We were celebrating a successful bachelorette & bachelor weekend. The menu isn't large but filled with plenty of choices to satisfy your tummy. One of our group is vegan and she was happy that there was at least one vegan option for her. I personally ordered the Eggs-Quisite Benedict which was beautiful! Only issues I had are my eggs were not poached properly so they had to remake them and there was no avocado like the menu stated. Once that was fixed it was AMAZING! Not many restaurants can get 11 dishes on the table at nearly the same time and Dirty Fork did that with little hiccup. Since we were celebrating the bride and groom to be the cook created a special crepe dessert for the couple to share. Another thing I was happy to hear is that the fruit is cut fresh all day long!   Aside from the food, the place was clean and welcoming. I work in the service so I understand the stress a large party can put on one server who has other tables to tend to and our server did a great job! Management was very kind and helpful and asked us to take a group photo in front of the Dirty Fork wall before we left. I will definitely be back next time I am in Las Vegas!

Qn7pJvntrXfW9-uNlfJgXg.text: I'm not one to complain much, but i must say I was really disappointed with this place. Coming from Hawaii, you expect that "aloha spirit" when you dine at a Hawaiian restaurant. This place had nothing but that. No acknowledgement whatsoever when we walked in. Stood there because the sign says to "wait to be seated" when they all just kind of looked at us like we were idiots. Finally got sat and then didn't hear back from our server for another 10+ minutes before she took a drink order. Forgot our drink order after another 10mins and the owner just drops us some water without saying a word. We finally get our orders taken and the server missed almost half our order! We wait patiently for our food and they messed it up! We ordered the North Shore Shrimp. Highly disappointed!!! Had about 5 little overcooked pieces of the shrimp in a pineapples bowl of rice. No where near the shrimps you get in Hawaii's food trucks. I was so disappointed that I almost sent it back- which I regretfully should have. Anyway, they forgot our daughters kids meal and rushed that order. Fries where not cooked throughly. Another disappointment.  Overall, I don't see us coming back here. We were mislead by the Hawaiian food and unfortunately did not get the True aloha spirit with it.

0fg2rVElJ89yE-BiBKB5UA.text: Locally owned and operated, it's another Hawaiian business bolstering the city's claim as the "9th island." The restaurant is located in the space formerly occupied by Norm's Eggs Cafe. They've done a great job making the interior more inviting with darker woods and turquoise paint to give it more of an island feel. There's a decent sized dining area and also a counter you can sit at that looks into the kitchen.   Their menu isn't very focused. There's some Hawaiian inspired fare that seems to be the main attractions and also shows the most creativity. Then there's some French and American dishes thrown in, along with a breakfast burrito. So, it's a hodgepodge of breakfast and lunch stuff that's probably good for their bottom line, but doesn't really show what they're about or where they want to take this restaurant.  On my first visit, shortly after they opened, I only grabbed a couple pastries. At the time they were outsourcing their pastries and the product was poor with the chocolate croissant soggy and limp and the almond croissant tasting like it was days old.  A second, more recent visit, showed much improvement. First, a thick, biscuit-like scone to start. Followed by their 9th Island French toast. Using a sweet Hawaiian bread, it's more like a dessert, but if you like sweets, you'll love this dish, especially when it's drenched in coconut syrup and guava cream cheese.  This place shows some promise but will have to re-focus their menu and improve their pastries.

rChSJ1oqF9XFYFQ71mL9nw.text: I was excited to try this place but I was very disappointed with the results.  I stopped by around 1pm with a friend. I had already looked up the menu and Yelp reviews prior to arriving. The place was empty except for people at a few of the two top tables by the windows. We ended up sitting at one of the bigger tables for 4 in the middle. The restaurant was warm. I'm cold natured so I'm figuring it was over 80 in there for me to even notice. All of the tables have the same kind of chairs, hard wooden with decorative designs on the back. They obviously don't want anyone hanging around. My back was killing me after just over an hour in these chairs.   We sat at the table for about 4 minutes before the cook came to give us menus (the waiter was focused on the few couples at the tables on the wall & cleaning dirty tables). The waiter came and took our drink order. I ordered a diet soda. It came in a can with a glass of ice that was melted into half water when presented to me. My friend received water no ice, no straw (she never asked for no ice and wanted a straw). We decided on what to order, a few minutes later we placed our order. I ordered a short stack of pancakes with coconut syrup. My friend ordered 2 scrambled eggs and a bagel(btw- they charge $1 extra for cream cheese on the bagel). While placing our order someone came in to sit at the counter. We waited and waited and waited for our food.  The guy at the counter got his food, ate, and left before we were served even though we ordered first. The cook was walking around, hanging out at the register, and certainly in no rush. It was about 30/40 minutes before we got our food. Finally the cook brings over our food. He drops it off with no silverware. We see him speaking to the waiter at the end of the counter (no customers/no register there, he was doing something by himself). The cook begins rolling some silverware. He brings it back to us 3 minutes after dropping off the food.  I was very disappointed that my item was not was described on the menu. Instead of coconut syrup on the pancakes, it had shredded coconut (which I don't like) and regular maple syrup. Either they are out of the coconut syrup (& didn't mention it) or their menu is written incorrectly. I didn't even feel like trying to get it corrected because it took so long to get this. I ate about a 1/4 of one pancake after scraping off the shredded coconut.   I asked for the check. The waiter brought it and took my debit card. After 10 minutes I had to ask for my card back.  He didn't have it in his hands and I was getting concerned that I saw him return one to someone that gave theirs a couple minutes after I gave mine. He was confused that he hasn't given it back and went looking for it. He returned it to me a couple of minutes later. I wasted $20 on 2 scrambled eggs, a bagel (no cream cheese), a canned soda, & 2 inedible pancakes.  TLDR: This place is over hyped. The service is incompetent in the afternoon. The menu doesn't match what you get. Waste of time and money.

Fu4ieB7vQ3A12Mo9R6264A.text: Came in for brunch today to try this out with the family.  We actually tried going to a different spot but the wait was 30min and I didn't want to wait so we came her next.   No wait. It was actually really empty on a Saturday morning at 11:00am.  It doesn't matter but we got here and I wanted to try the dishes they are known for so I ordered their Dirty Fork Breakfast.  The kids had the blueberry pancake and my husband ordered their turkey sandwich.   Blueberry pancake: My kids didn't like the blueberries.  That was my fault in ordering it.  They said that the blueberry in the pancake tasted funny.  So, I tried it.  It was fine. I guess the kids don't like Blueberry?  My Dirty Fork Breakfast was AWESOME!   My son took the french toast bread and my daughters took the strawberry and eggs. I was left with some fried chicken.    My husbands turkey sandwich:  The sandwich was suppose to have sprouts but it didn't come with any. He also said that the turkey was too thin compared to what you'd get at other diners. So he didn't like his sandwich but he was so hungry he ate the whole thing.   Service: AMAZING.  But then again, we were the only ones in the restaurant. The lady was super nice and came back many times to help us out. I wished there were more people in there.    It's not bad. I am just surprised nobody was there.

CnrSqTTNC7jdpO8m1MCC4A.text: Located off Durango Dr. in Vegas not too far from the Strip. It's in a small plaza parking is shared with the other businesses. Ok first off this review may a bit basis since I know the owner and she's a good friend. Anyways so we came here for lunch met up with other Yelpers that happened to be in Vegas this same weekend. The place is not huge there are a good amount of tables. Service was great depending on how crowded it is and what food you order it could take a while. The menu has a lot of choices from Breakfast and lunch. They are opened till about 3pm and only serve breakfast and lunch dishes. You can take out as well. I got the big Island breakfast which is Portuguese sausage, two eggs served you way and rice. It was yummy. Everyone seemed to enjoy their dishes as well. Overall a great breakfast spot if you want that Hawaiian style type breakfast I recommend stopping by. They do get packed in the morning hours afternoon like after 12:45pm gets less busy. I'd come back for sure.

mtY9iLCtLErugiagGsVktQ.text: Had brunch on Sunday. What a delicious treat!! The eggs bennys were amazing! PERFECTLY cooked served with fresh greens and an amazing raspberry dressing. Looking forward to going back and working my way thru the rest of the menu.

5394PS7eEBy9BTGDMMK3ig.text: Ughhh where do I begin ?! I feel really bad putting the dirty fork on blast but I believe it's the right thing to do to ensure no one gets any food born illnesses from cross contamination or worse. Today I decided to visit the Dirty Fork because of the great reviews and I love trying new places in town. I immediately noticed the disarray of the kitchen and how exposed it was as it is in the front of the house . I tried to overlook it and just enjoy myself however as time went on I became more and more upset with what I was seeing. The cooks were not using proper tools or gloves when handling eggs, then going over to fix a salad or top off breakfast items with fruit etc. servers were making some of the items without wearing gloves or using cutting boards on surfaces that had leftover food, eggs and remnants from previous items being prepared . What frustrated me the most was watching a woman cut oranges on the filthy counter top with no gloves and then pressing them to make fresh juice. There is no doubt in my mind that these oranges were not washed beforehand and they 100% came in contact with raw food items such as eggs . On top of it all there were numerous people complaining around us which just created a negative atmosphere . In terms of the food it was mediocre at best . The French toast was however a total sham . They charge $11.95 for simply the toast and then charge $2 for "fresh fruit" that was man handled with no gloves or tools . Needless to say I won't be returning and highly suggest that they get their Sh*t together before they end up on dirty dining !

GGKw2SNNFaPl-BqARJBAKA.text: Love this little breakfast/lunch place! We just picked randomly and really lucked out. The place has a very laid back Hawaiin vibe. EHDb9sCfR3nIoQ-2V83O8Q.text: It has a nice vibe/ cute atmosphere. The food tastes great and is better than any regular breakfast. The staff is really nice and welcoming. Great place for brunch and catching up with friends or a date.

434sVc79TWU8VVT4qP2x8Q.text: The food was actually fantastic and had incredibly generous portions, but considering that we were there at 10 am on a Sunday morning and this is a breakfast joint, we predict it won't be around for long. And maybe that's a good thing -- although I hate to say it because the service was great and the food was SUPER delicious (although kind of pricey which might explain why it was kind of slow during prime brunch time).   One disturbing thing was that there are several pineapples prominently displayed over the glass cooler, but they are clearly drying out and going bad (the leaves are brown and crispy). This tells me that they are not turning their stock quickly enough.   Another disturbing thing was that I could see the reach in glass cooler case door was kept open the entire time (probably 80 minutes) we were there -- this is also where they store the eggs for breakfast, so basically the eggs might as well be sitting out on the counter, as there is no way that those eggs are being kept at the proper temperature if typical operating procedure is to keep the reach in cooler door open all the time. During the time we were there, I saw both employees reaching into the cooler to take things out and not shutting the door, so this tells me that this is their normal habit. Even more disturbing is that there were a ton of pastries in that cooler that were not covered and several flies buzzing around the restaurant, which is a signal that there's a problem somewhere back of house too.

I didn't even notice the change on their menu and proceeded to show the Yelp and Eat 24 menu to everyone working there because after months of anticipation I was disappointed. Well much to my surprise they brought me a complimentary plate of prosciutto to make up for the confusion. Apparently they changed their menu but Yelp and Eat 24 hadn't had updated it yet. I admit I was a tad bit dramatic about the issue but I take my food seriously lol. The Lunch Special was amazing both ways. Salmon and prosciutto. I loved the decorations and waiter was very good. FeMi-6Sncp9Y8OJtOeW8_g.text: This is a great breakfast and brunch spot! They have a lot of island themed dishes, as well as some French options. I tried the Ms. Madame. It was similar to the French croque madame with a few twists. The egg on top was cooked perfectly. It had a Swiss cheese instead of the traditional white sauce. There was also Dijon mustard which gave it a nice tang. The micro green salad included was fresh, with a multitude of dressing options. The island pancakes were fluffy and light. I tried their house made guava syrup, and it was excellent! It was light and sweet. Also there was a side menu which included some other dishes, like Loco Moco. I did try the Portuguese sausage that was on that menu. They definitely need to add that to their regular menu. It had a great texture that was soft and the meat was fresh and seasoned well. I definitely recommend coming here for a great breakfast that is upscale from your standard diner!

jNXWIuJyVuprFHdnbPBByw.text: My new spot!   Me and my doggies loved the service here.   There is no doggie menu, so bring your own treats, but there do bring out a water bowl.   The coffee was smooth not too strong or bitter.  I had the turkey sandwich which was fresh.  Love the avocado smash on the bread.  My friend had the Ceasar Salad ...it was generously loaded with cheese and he requested bacon rather than chicken and they accommodated. Also ingredients are fresh and organic.    While our service was great! I was more impressed by the owner coming out and asking if everything was ok and he warmly greeted my dogs.

hx_oOusCdSakdIzOUtle_w.text: We got a Groupon to check out this new restaurant. Atmosphere is quaint; tables are close together so you can hear the conversation next to you, but it's not too distracting. The cooks are out in the open & you can see the kitchen and the serving area, so you know exactly how long your food sits & waits once it is plated. Saturday afternoon, not too busy, & we were seated immediately. We ordered both breakfast and lunch items. The bacon was extra crispy. Burgers cooked well. Fries had an added herb/spice that made them savory over salty. Sadly, as we went to pay the owner elected to charge a "Groupon tax" after the fact. We use Groupon to test out a lot of new restaurants and we've never had to pay this fee. We contacted Groupon & they handled it for us, but it kinda spoiled the meal to argue with the manager over this random fee. Hopefully, they will fix this for their future customers.

O3OlnBq2EgKqSyky4CjljA.text: So, this was a wonderfully unexpected find. I work up the road and was looking for a local lunch spot and stumbled onto this gem in the desert. I was feeling like a light lunch so I went with the Caesar salad with chicken. The house made dressing was delicious!!! Chicken cooked to perfection and I really loved the addition of sunflower seeds for texture and taste. I also had the Spam Musubi and it was the best thing I've eaten all week  great job! I'll be back for a burger that caught my eye on the menu. Happy to have u in the neighborhood

6nr3Doyri-IfwB8WkermEA.text: Ok. Where to start... been bookmarked for quite some time. Love all the #dirtyfork pics on instagram. Finally got here with my daughter. She knows her food.  We got: dirty fork lunch special: too much going on. Like wayyyy too much. Texture was strange. It was beautifully plated. It truly gave me the same feeling as the restaurant itself- confused. Too many "good" ideas. Mis mashed. How do I explain this... from the decor to the food. It just felt... confused is the only word that comes to mind.  turkey sammy: good... I think. I dunno, again- too much. Hard to get a complete bite. I like my sandwiches stable. I like them balanced. short stack of island pancakes: GREAT. all the syrups were yummy. They were fluffy, light, absolutely delicious.  Here's the bottom line- go. Try it. Make up your own mind. Support small businesses. My take is just that- mine.  (ATTN OWNER!!!)Last BUT NOT LEAST- get rid of the elevator music please. I think that was the worst. Waited quite a while for our food and the music in the background just made it feel like I was in a doctors office. Play some chill good vibe island sounds. Isn't that your "thing"?? Again- confused.

5Gmi2AlQE5Bei81Yc523Dw.text: We've been talking about coming here for a while now, and so we visited for breakfast. It is, in a word, WOW!  We enjoyed: . 9th Island French Toast - Friends, you ain't gonna buy this Hawaiian bread at Walmart! The bread is shipped from Hawaii and turned into slices of heaven! Served with guava cream cheese and coconut syrup, my wife and I fought over the last piece! . What The Fork Omelette - Bell Peppers, sweet onions, mushrooms, and Swiss cheese, topped with avocado and served with a side of organic greens. Light, fluffy, flavorful and delicious!  A word about the service: From the time we came in, sat down, ordered, and was served, 12 minutes. 12. It felt like 2. Not only that everybody in the place, including the staff, is smiling and enjoying themselves. Gotta love it!

Wrtj7gZ6sA_t0OJnEUsYeA.text: 2 for 2 this weekend, and this why we are creatures of habit. Both new places we tried was a bust! We decided to try Dirty Fork as their IG looks promising, big mistake on my end as normally I peruse their yelp page prior to going somewhere new. I know I know rookie move. I should've read Lavi's review.   It started out great as there was no wait. The server came promptly to take our drink orders. You ran out of Hawaiian Sun? Okay fine give me coffee instead. I mentioned I had a groupon, she said nope only on weekdays. My bad I should've checked. I turned to my husband to confirm if it was just me or does the server have a really bad attitude, he said no it's not just your imagination. Moving on.   Food was ordered: 2 Big island breakfast which consisted of Portuguese sausage, eggs and for $2 more Hawaiian fried rice. I ordered the Jade pancakes full stack and asked for both the lilikoi and coconut syrup. Son had the breakfast special and daughter had strawberry Nutella crepes. When the food came they had regular rice for my husband and only had the coconut syrup for me. I mentioned it to the older gentleman that dropped off our food and I swear to God he interrupted me mid sentence and said WAIT! Wait what?!?!? Wtf! did you just seriously tell me wait and walked away?!?!? WOW! I'm in no way confrontational but it took a lot in me to not say something. Soon enough someone dropped off the so called fried rice with no apology or nothing. Ummm I don't know where they've had Hawaiian fried rice coz that was not it, advertised as having spam too and that was not spam! I've been eating spam my whole life, I would know. So the girl server comes back and I informed her I didn't get my Lilikoi syrup, and my son told me she straight up rolled her eyes! The pancakes were so dry and dense. At this point I've lost my appetite and stopped eating altogether. The Portuguese sausage was extra extra crispy which translates to barely edible.   Needless to say we will not be back. I'm sorry but the management need to retrain their people and emphasize ALOHA. Service was abysmal. Nothing worst than going to a restaurant and be completely disappointed with the service and the food. Ummmm NO!!!!

t7og--9S8pVtcSjNljUoQA.text: I don't think it would be possible to get better than this. Phenomenal food, generous portions, impeccable plating, off-the-charts customer service, gorgeous coffee and a reasonable price point. I've eaten here twice, and will be back many more times. When you're at the Dirty Fork, you feel like family. Do yourself a favor and get the hot coffee - it's not your typical diner coffee. A turkish roast with phenomenal mouth-feel, each sip is a buttery treat for your taste buds. The avocado toast will BLOW YOU AWAY with smoked salmon, fresh fruit, greek yogurt, sunflower seeds and the most perfectly poached eggs I've ever encountered. I didn't want this meal to end. The french toast is a feast, I took half of mine home! French toasted Hawaiian sweet bread topped with scrambled eggs, chicken tender nuggets, fresh sweet strawberries, and fresh whipped cream. Holy moly. My husband says the burger was one of the best in Vegas, and the fatty burrito was bomb.com - his words, not mine. I'm super stoked the Dirty Fork followed me on Instagram one day (rocksteady81) because after cruising through their feed, we headed immediately down to check them out :)

79cKRI0-9pAb1m9E-vWcDg.text: I've had their food on Postmates but never been in the restaurant. I was TOTALLY DISAPPOINTED!!! The only thing that was well cooked was my Soy latte and they wasn't even that good... I'm Over it. Won't be going back.

dGEHw8OAh0ptSeNJ5LGZfg.text: Came here on Thursday with a girlfriend on our first day here in Vegas because we were craving avocado roasts and the reviews on Yelp looked promising. And boy were the reviews correct. Just looking at the presentation alone of the poached eggs, the fruit, and, of course the star of the show, the toast with sliced avocado and smoked salmon. The best way to eat this is to take a poached egg as carefully as you can and put it on top of the toast and then break the yolk into the salmon and avocado. This really hit the spot. I enjoyed every bite and was so full after. The owner was so nice and gave us flyers for a free drink with an entree purchase to come back. I was so pleased with both the food and the warmth of the service that we both decided to come back again during our short trip.   We came by again on out last day (Sunday) and my friend got the Eggs Benedict instead and I got the same Vegas Style Avo toast. There was a little mishap in the kitchen so our food was late but it was still worth the wait - the food was amazing. The owners felt so bad that they have us a small percentage off our bill for the food being late. All in all, I enjoyed my time and if I'm ever in the Vegas area again I will be checking out this place!

QcF0Rhg66lvZg0YqsB3BMw.text: I'll give this place the benefit of the doubt. Maybe it wasn't a good day for the workers, maybe it wasn't a good day for me to eat here. Whatever the reasoning was, I was hungry and tried it out.   From the get-go, I had a feeling that things were not gonna go right. First, the pluses....the place was clean, tables were cleared, and restrooms were being up-kept. Now, the minuses....like I said before, I am giving it the benefit of the doubt. The service was slow, no one came over to ask if we needed any more water, seeing that our clear water bottle was empty. And, the food took a little longer than anticipated.   Okay, on to the food. First Up, the Spam Musubi! I know that there are different ways that people make it, but why would you drench the bottom of the plate with Olive Oil, with the Spam Musubi on top! I know they may try to make it fancy looking, just little drops of the oil around the plate would have sufficed! Not all on the bottom of the plate. Next was the Korean Fried Chicken Wings. Which was not....It was just fried chicken on a bed of little romaine lettuce leaves. You DO NOT use Shoyu, or Soy Sauce as the sauce for the Korean Fried Chicken Wings. You use Korean BBQ Sauce!   Maybe I'll give it another try next time, but I was not impressed with this trip today!

15OP57djvck94Dflcf46NQ.text: A solid breakfast/lunch menu that has a bit of an island flavor to it. We stopped on a whim, after passing by a few times. Glad we did. This is a solid choice for your 'breakfasty' cravings.  A clean place with a solid and pleasant design. The display counter for pastries is fun to look at and is enticing. The only down-side we experienced was that the floor was a bit greasy and therefore, a bit slippery.  Believe it or not, my wife claims that she has smelled the fish n chips as she passed by. And while they don't have bottles of vinegar (eh...packets), they do have multiple pieces (not just one big piece-yuck) and nicely done chips. Instead of paying $30 a plate on the strip for a decent plate of fish n chips...come here. I will return for this dish.  There are many menu options that sound tempting and are interestingly named). We went with the salmon/mushroom/ eggs/garlic sauce on toast. Perfectly portioned for such a decadently rich dish. Another one worth a repeat.  The people are  nice here and its a very relaxed atmosphere. We will happily return.

EZIx5lvM9gLLMN7W5iG4Pg.text: OVER PRICED, SUB PAR SERVICE, SNOBBY OWNER, UNFAIR SERVICE CHARGE  I went to Dirty Fork with family for brunch on a recommendation.  Honestly, I was just not impressed.  Not even a little bit.  The food was just okay - nothing to write home about.  And for what it is, it was too expensive.  I had a Caesar salad with no chicken and it was $10.25.  A small glass of orange juice was $5.00 and a small glass of milk was $3.00.    The service was barely acceptable.  Our waitress was very scatter-brained.  I kid you not, she got distracted mid-pour (refilling my coffee) and walked away.  Because she had to go to the kitchen to grab food to deliver to a different table.  She also never came back to finish refilling my coffee.    At some point, the restaurant owner came over to our table to say hello.  But her demeanor was very snobby.  It's hard to describe.  But I did not get any warm-and-fuzzies from the interaction.    Also, they charge an automatic 20% service charge.  TWENTY PERCENT!!!  We had a large party, so I understand the automatic gratuity.  BUT, most restaurants charge between 15 - 18% gratuity for large parties.  They are pretty brazen to charge 20%, and for BRUNCH no less!  PLUS, they did not inform in any way, shape, or form in regards to the automatic gratuity.  Normally, restaurants would either post the policy somewhere visible inside the establishment or it would be printed on the menu.  NOPE.  They just happily slapped me with the 20% service charge and after providing me with crappy service.  I called the restaurant and made a complaint later on that day because I was really unhappy with the experience.  The person that answered the phone took down my information and said the owner would give us a call back to resolve our inquiry.  SHE NEVER CALLED ME BACK.  BOTTOM LINE:  I DO NOT RECOMMEND THIS PLACE.

CnEO15nVL5DQCZqDoe7SBg.text: Decor is great, food, not so much. Ordered a pretty basic breakfast and got some over cooked eggs. I was in a hurry and it was really cold in the restaurant so I decided not to ask for it to be remade. More staff than patrons. Cool staff was loud and seemed to be more interested in talking and who is clocking in than preparing proper food.  Server was nice but neglected to count back my change and I ended up getting short changed. Easily corrected, but an oversight that probably shouldn't happen.  It has potential. Hope they turn it around and maybe restaff the kitchen.

gh9IDirsWQEglVb1AfpuSw.text: Let me clarify the rating...  Food: 5 stars. It's clean, delicious, and presented well.   Location: Tons of parking, easy access off Durango.  The restaurant is lovely, adorned with hand blown lamps and ornaments, stained concrete floors, and corrugated steel.   They play nice, classical piano music but distractingly, they also have a flat screen television on the wall showing close up video shots of food being cooked. The visuals are fine but the constant white noise of the sizzling emanating from the television, and competing with the Muzak, is annoying.    Service: 1 (and that's being generous).   The hostess sat us under the annoying sizzle and we couldn't hear ourselves talk, so we asked to move tables.   As I read the menu, the server plopped my cup of coffee right in front of my face, on top of the menu, we instead of next to me. It was rude and unprofessional.    When our food arrived, the same server said, "Your server will bring you your condiments."  Forget the confusion over who our server actually was, to let our food grow cold while they brought us basics like salt and pepper was unacceptable. Why aren't those things on the table already, or brought in advance?  I had to get up and ask for those items.   After the food was brought to us, no one checked on us again. It wasn't until after I paid for my food that I was offered a refill on my coffee.   Oddly, they also have a tip jar for the kitchen staff. I tipped them because they deserve it. The jar is probably there because the back of the house knows that if they're splitting tips with the front of the house, they'll likely get very little dto the poor service.   I'd probably try this place again because of the exceptional food. I only hope they get their service act together.

C1MPFJtokaJVhPq5pd3rjQ.text: AVOID THIS PLACE AT ALL COSTS.   Well we literally just got up and left, right now. Like 8 minutes ago.   Walked in on a Sunday morning, 1 group in front of us the waitress tells them to go seat themselves and we do the same. The place has 3 tables already seated and then us and another group. The waitress tells us a few times it'll be a minute, no problem we say. At least 10 minutes go by while she is running around trying to figure out what to do, and a couple walks in and goes to the bar to sit down, assuming they are regulars based on what ends up happening.   Another server comes in for his shift (I've seen him be the main server multiple times by himself, this place always operates with 1 maybe 2 staff....)   He waltzes in and goes behind the counter and starts to chit chat meanwhile there is 2 tables we are a 4 top the other table is a 5 top, without drinks and it's been 15 minutes. Literally.   He says something to the couple at the bar and I QUOTE....."screw those people they can wait" multiple times to the couple, as he waves towards our tables in the dining area. Loud and proud. I'm assuming the couple said "are you sure??" As he pours them their drinks (which we didn't even get yet....15 minutes in.) What an ASSHOLE. So instead of making a scene we just look at each other and get up and on our way down the street to PEGS AND EGGS. Just pulling up the place doesn't have an empty seat in the joint which is promising. I'd rather wait in a full establishment than wait in a place that has 4 tables and doesn't know what the hell to do.   The only reason this place is still in business is because it has some family relation to the landlord. Otherwise this place is a total shithole service wise and will surely fail.   With 10 breakfast places in 3 square miles from this location you have 2 things that make you distinguishable.....1- customer service which this place is a 0/10 and 2- food which couldn't tell you since #1 matters more than 2.   Avoid.

awCmNhKS6SLJ3XNIfH4jtA.text: Came in for lunch today ended up ordering off the breakfast menu for the most part. Just a few other tables were occupied and 1 waitress to assist. We ordered a sprite and iced latte and waters to drink. We got an acai bowl, French toast, pancakes and tea sandwich. The acai bowl was alright, it wasn't as sweet as we hoped but still good. The French toast with fruit was tasty. The pancakes were a little on the dry side but huge portion. The tea sandwich came with tiramisu and macaroons. The spread on the sandwich we good, the tiramisu would've been better if it weren't so dry. Oh and fries which were awesome with ranch! The fries saved the rating! They were nice and crispy. Good thing we had a groupon because the bill was $60 and we didn't even have meat. It was nice to try someplace different. It's not close to home so we probably won't be back for awhile.

P94uI8WhHDUNml9MW3Rc9g.text: Was looking for a place I could grab lunch with my puppy today.  Saw the tables outside and thought I'd give it a try! So happy I did!  The servers were nice enough to bring me a menu as I sat outside with my pup.  Honestly all the options sounded so good, it was difficult to choose.      The server KJ brought out a carafe of water, which tasted great! Not that vegas water flavor that I usually decline to drink.  I also started with a glass of orange juice, only because it is fresh! I usually dislike OJ, the one they've got here is delicious and frothy.    Burger with avocado and fries- Really exceeded my expectations. The bread reminds me of something from shake shack. So good! It's probably the first time I did not need to add any ranch.  The avocado was saucy enough on its own that the burger needed nothing extra.  The fries!! Such a nice crunch on the outside, super good all by itself. I can't think of where I've had this texture of fries before. Definitely stands out from other places.    Lunch special- took a bite from my girlfriend's plate. If you are looking for something light it's a great option!   It has salmon, arugula, mushrooms, pico de gallo, with a poached egg the yolk just oozing.  You can tell the thought they put into this menu.  Everything is so yummy!  I thought I'd have a super quick and casual lunch. I surprising enjoyed my afternoon here and decided to stay a little longer.   KJ told me about their afternoon tea offering.  Which I can't wait to try next time!  I didn't have much space so I opted for a cup of tea and macaroons. They were just the right amount of sweet to finish off my meal.   I'm looking forward to making this my social spot.  Afternoon tea is already on my schedule!

1XnY-QV_0-OgE6cNb0aLag.text: The place smelled like sewage. They didn't honor the Groupon deal. The owner had his dog there, which he was walking around everywhere looking for food. The owner was sitting at the bar, showing off his fat harry crack. I was not impressed and will never be going back there. The waitress told me she had only been working there for 3 months and today was her last day. The waiter before her, who started waiting on me left because he said it was too slow. I should have known when I walked in there and noticed it was empty during a time that should have been busy, that something was wrong. RED FLAG.

0O3VfJce5gy1jyaDcMBd0g.text: Came here with my mom for lunch after she received a DM on instagram from someone at Dirty Fork asking for us to come try the food (and offered a discount). My mom was interested after seeing their Instagram photos so we came in. As soon as we walked in, we weren't acknowledged at all and were standing awkwardly behind a table of seated guests. Two employees looked at us but said nothing; one of them even walked right in front of us but still said nothing.   Finally, we were acknowledged by someone at the cash register. She said it would be a few minutes until we were seated. There were only a handful of tables taken so we were confused as to why we had to wait when there were so many tables that weren't taken. Turns out, no one thought it'd be a good idea to clear and clean the tables after patrons left. Literally every table was still full of used plates and cups! Then one of the employees tried seating us at one of these tables when I noticed there was a table literally right next to the door that was clean so we told her we'd rather sit there than at a dirty table. She sat us down and then walked away. We didn't even get to place our drink order for almost 5 minutes because she took so long to come back to us.  After we were finally able to place our food and drink order, we got our drinks pretty quickly (I mean, it was a latte and orange juice). I was a bit confused because she placed our drinks down and left without asking if I wanted sugar (which is typical since some people like to put sugar in their lattes). I took a sip anyway and it was SWEET. I like my lattes sweet so I enjoyed it but for those who prefer a latte, well, to taste like a latte, this is not what you'd expect. I think they should have removed the sweetness factor and give patrons the option to sweeten it to their preference because not everyone expects their lattes to come pre-sweetened. Or, they should have asked if I wanted it pre-sweetened or not.   Our meals didn't create any sparks, so nothing to particularly rave about. We weren't happy with the lack of cleanliness and desire to clean up the tables after being used, the extremely slow and lackluster customer service, and food that didn't live up to the hype. Perhaps it was an off day, but the three things I just mentioned shouldn't happen anyway.

My friend had a coupon for free coffee and when I checked in on Yelp we got a free soda, they honored both. I almost got some pastries to go but I was so full. The service was better-than- reviewed and my coffee never went empty. The waitress checked on us often. There was no wait to sit down, it was actually kind of dead inside. The only downside are the prices, they are a little higher than I expected but the flavor makes up for the price. If you are on the side of town I suggest giving them a try.

n-CBnOMLBsrCNazZrbigYw.text: We came here last month and was quite peeved because they were already closed at 2:30pm, when their hours were until 3:30pm. We decided to give them another try.   We were the 4th 2-person table, with 2 at the bar, and a table with 7 people. Considering that Jodi was the cashier, the server, and the busser,  hopefully people can see it for what it is, a small eatery in a cut throat industry with a small profit margin, and give some consideration to the slightly slower service. It was very slight, 20 minutes from when we were seated to when the food arrived.   Bottom line, coffee was strong, our Breakfast Special was plated nicely with a lot of food, and not expensive at all. The chicken was quite juicy, as breastmeat aren't usually.  My 9th island french toast was delicious with yummy guava cream cheese, I wished there were a little more of it. I added the fresh fruit for an additional $2, which included. Pineapple, blueberries, and strawberries. The side of hashbrowns were cooked perfectly, crispy brown on the outside.

57cw8oyp2eOT1bMLeDMDaA.text: Discovered this little breakfast eatery the other day on the way home, and we were not disappointed! We ordered food to-go (smoked salmon eggs benedict / 9th island french toast) and were pleasantly surprised to find both looking still very appetizing and thoughtfully arranged even in take-away containers.   My order of the french toast was fluffy and delicious and the portion size was definitely hefty (I ate one slice and shared the other two with family). My only complaint was that my order seemed to be missing the guava cream cheese... I was really looking forward to trying it! But other than that, the meal overall was a lovely treat :)  Their bakery and treats display at the counter threw me off a little, too. I wanted to order additional baked goods (they were clearly displayed with price tags), but was told the ones I wanted were "display only". I didn't mind it too much, but was just baffled as to why they would leave them in the case with their prices presented as if to sell when they weren't available... it made me feel a little foolishly baited, haha.  I can't say how the eggs benedicts tasted as it wasn't my order, but my brother seemed to enjoy it. All in all a positive first impression with Dirty Fork.

QFuChhw7GFjThAcib_ro_g.text: If you're looking for an incredible brunch experience this is the place to go. The atmosphere feels like like a French cafe The food is an incredible mix of sweet and savory in the best way.   We've always seen it many times online and finally decided to make the trip.   We were seated immediately and I ordered a coffee  and the Chocolate Croissant  The coffee was so delicious, and the croissant was warm and covered with a rich chocolate sauce. What an incredible way to start off the meal.   I also ordered the Beach Day Spam Musubi and it was so beautifully plated, freshly made, and so big!  Incredibly delicious and smelled like the sea.  We were so impressed right away and next thing we knew our entrees were out in front of us. Rod had ordered the Dirty Fork Breakfast Special and I decided to try the Vegas Style Avocado Toast.   The Dirty Fork Breakfast Special: French Toast made with Hawaiian sweet toast, eggs, Fried chicken pieces  strawberry  , and whipped cream. So delicious! Rod and I both loved the flavor, it was big enough for two people to share!   Vegas Style Avocado Toast: Multigrain Toast with Avocado  topped with tossed greens, delicious salmon, and a salsa and garnished with sunflower seeds  with two poached eggs on the side. (So worth not owning a home )   The only downside is that the table wasn't big enough for all the food lol!  You need to try this place! Period!

ftEmaGrbPjIpGQb-jPmJsA.text: I give this place 2 stars because of FOOD SAFETY, I feel like it used to be a well taken care place.... the waiter was really nice and sweet and did not give us a hard time when I sent my steak back for being well done and not medium.               My only issue was the cross-contamination that I saw, it bothered me because I actually work in the food industry so I didn't know how to feel about it. I saw a pot of raw eggs stirred up for omelettes sitting in the pastry case broadcasting all the delicious pastries WITH THE CARTON OF EGGS NEXT TO the pastries!! You cant put cooked items next to raw eggs, cross-contamination. I took photos  to show proof and I hope the owner gets on the workers cleanliness and organization skills a bit more especially FOOD SAFETY!

5uIaRtkz0pg-zjYNa5PKgw.text: It was okay. There are better places but I don't think you will be disappointed.  I didn't like my order but everything else I saw one out looked amazing.

As soon as we walked in we weren't even greeted properly a man wearing dirty clothes sat us which tbh he looked homeless.....the waiter that helped us didnt even kno what was on the menu didnt ask us what we wanted for drinks and then my cousin ordered a vegan dish and they didnt even have any rice to go with her order especially when half the items on the menu come with rice!! dzbN69x_ALbJF5oe0F0V8w.text: Very nice place, never a long wait and the food is great. You get the feeling that someone is cooking for you personally instead of just pumping out what's written down by the server. If you haven't tried this place it's definitely worth it.

ubbiyM4sOcioi2htX_ZS1w.text: Bookmarked this place for a long time and I decided to come here for my brunch. Ordered Sunrise Sammy, Breakfast special and couple sides including french fries, hash browns. We also requested to put fried chicken on the side instead of combining into our toast ( Breakfast special).   As we shared our dishes, we got chances to try a bit of everything. So, it's weird to say but we actually like the side dishes than the main entrees we ordered!!! Toasts that were in the Breakfast special was too sweet and the fried chicken was dry and lack of flavour. Sunrise Sammy, which is a croissant stuffed with bacon, egg and cheddar, was very dry and not warm. Hash browns were the only dish we enjoyed eating...   Staff were not very attentive and helpful. We had to wave a lot of time before they could spot us, which was an unpleasant experience.

photos.caption: Photo of Dirty Fork - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Breakfast special(toast), Sunrise Sammy(croissant), hash browns, french fries and fried chopped chicken on the side.

EzP7FQex7PC9J1FgyNIhdQ.text: Came by today for breakfast with the fam, I saw that they had Hawaiian style breakfast, so I figured we should come and try it. It's also pretty pricey for such small portions.  I ordered my son a fruit cup with a butter croissant. I don't mind paying $5 for a fruit cup as long as the quality of the fruit is worth it, in this case it definitely wasn't. Fruit was soggy and didn't seem so fresh. The croissant wasn't that great either. I would've rather had a croissant from Starbucks.   I had the Hawaiian style fried rice (I think that's what it was called) for about $11, and I was expecting a huge portion for that price. But no, it was small and the rice was kind of hard. Didn't care for it. The mac salad was also unusual, I didn't like it either. We also got the Loco Moco, which was kind of bland.   The service was HORRIBLE. We had a good start when we came in, there was a guy with glasses, he was nice. But nobody came to refill our coffees, til we asked. If we didn't ask, I'm pretty sure nobody would've came. Nobody came to check on us to see how we were doing, literally not even once. I made my boyfriend go up and pay for our meal because I knew nobody was gonna come to ask us if we wanted the check. The man with the black shirt that showed his stomach hanging out and the beard, dropped off our food and he did not look happy to be there lol. I was watching him interact with the table sitting in front of us and he looked like he hated his job, I thought it was pretty funny that he had such a crappy attitude.   Needless to say, we left a really bad tip. And I probably won't ever come back. The only thing I really cared for was the coffee.

3yup7wLGoD_ag2mW4liLhQ.text: First time here at Dirty Fork, I got the Fatty Burrito. It came w/a side of salsa fresca & some seasonal fruit. Overall it was alright, nothing that I'd say "omg I need to go back for it!". I do appreciate how they have outdoor seating to accommodate pets. Probably bc there's the dog park right down the road. Nice little brunch place, I'll definitely order something else next time.

photos.caption: Photo of Dirty Fork - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fatty Burrito

5-Oa3rx5dSt1ZMWwEz_5XQ.text: Wow, it's good. We had the benedict and the breakfast special. Everything was super fresh and super good. Definitely recommended for a great breakfast while visiting Vegas.

pbGmgcqge5xpqIkTAmCJlQ.text: I ate here yesterday for the first and last time.  The server was good and she tried to resolve the issue as best she could.  I ordered a caprese sandwich which I have had many many other places.  I ate about 1/4 of the sandwich but could not continue as my cheese spelled like fish. Not just a slight smell but a very strong smell.  Since when does mozzeralla smell like fish? I told the server that about my sandwich and she took it and smelled it confirming what I smelled. The cook denied smelling any fish of course.  Scary huh? The server apologized, offered discounts, and replaced my meal with a strawberry/banana crepes which was good.

aG_odj_SNUEL1N-IANjgVA.text: We just had an deliciuos lunch at Dirty Fork!  My wife and I shared the Bruschetta.  You get to pick three choices from a wide range of options.  We decided on the brie with apple and fig spread, fresh mozzarella with tomato and basil, and prosciutto and marcaspone.  Everyone of those choices were very tasty.  We also split the petit bruerre pannini, grilled chicken.  Again, awesome meal!  The freshly squeezed orange juice was the best and after lunch we shared a connoli which was on point (crispy shell!) and I had a cappuccino.  Excellent all the way around!!!  We will return on our next trip to Vegas.  I definitely recommend!!!!

My friend ordered the Dirty Fork Breakfast Special and she really liked it. I had a bite of it and I really liked the fried chicken on the french toast with the strawberries. cti8cx4NrfoOQUowboTnrA.text: Very inventive place for brunch. The entrees, while usual, are given a Hawaiian or Turkish spin reflecting the owners. Staff were friendly and knowledgable. Homemade pastries and tea selections would make a great place for high tea.

b8lprNebnYZLxo0b_sGnOg.text: This place was AMAZING! It's such a nice breakfast/lunch place. Very nice and accommodating staff, great presentation of food, and really yummy food. There's a lot on the menu that I still want to try and I will definitely be back.

2E3TeSMqEkg3o0hIYIS-HQ.text: So, this place came up in a list of suggestions and I'm always looking to try new places. They make a mean cappuccino and their bakery case was full of delicious looking pastries, including a variety of fresh croissants.  My hubby had a burger. It's was really tasty with a special sauce that set it apart from the usual. It was fresh and presented beautifully. I had a BLT which was also very good. Both entrees came with super crispy fries.  While we sat drinking our coffees the owner struck up a conversation with us. Although this place is new, his experience in the restaurant business is not and it shows. He bent over backwards to make sure we had a pleasant experience from beginning to end. He told us he wants to start dinner service soon and that the restaurant will also be available for private events. I really enjoyed the hospitality and look forward to returning.

qy9XO-UbfsNraJjL92i7hQ.text: If you're looking for good eats and a good bang for your buck, definitely give Dirty Fork a shot. American, French & Turkish inspired dishes that will knock your socks off. Staff & owner are very personable, attentive to detail & kind. Be sure to come with an appetite

iUplAIGLWGVdcaM8jBnN7Q.text: If you are looking for a nice, clean, intimate setting with good fresh quality food to have breakfast or lunch than the Dirty Fork is the place. The Manager and the staff was very nice and personable.  My only gripe is the coffee was great but could be hotter. I just loved the smooth rounded mug so this place still gets 5

KKkf5QSn3pTW-ojj7KEL4A.text: I went to the Dirty Fork the first day it opened and the food has been amazing along with the service has been since. N3os0tWhFS1jyr_Gc7v13Q.text: Breakfast was delicious. We tried the Sammy and the Ms Lorraine quiche with side of hashbrowns. The orange juice was the best in town and organic. The owner and chef was also very nice to come greet us. Will come back!

av_GGAI6fJAmdAMxTePQIQ.text: Literally sat down for about 15 minutes without even getting drinks from the waitress. Then after ordering drinks she walked by me 3 separate times without taking my food order. I got up and left, terrible service!! Sad thing is I really wanted to eat here.

1pL6eCwPxVK3R2Gr_UNVIA.text: We came here for breakfast last Sunday. The food was amazing. I got the 9th Island French Toast and he got the Dirty Fork yumminess chicken French toast strawberry thing. Stick with the fresh made food here and you won't be disappointed.

nQRuiPmeCaojm06nBQSvlw.text: I went to dirty fork enjoyed a good breakfast, service was very good. Mgr/owner "Fatih" he was very engaging and made you feel very welcomed. I have eaten there more than once with family and by myself. I have enjoyed each experience.

KGhbO26225Dm0r__6qp58Q.text: Ambiance: looks like newly renovated, upscale look, with authentic wood finishes, good for family breakfast  Cleanliness: 10/10 super clean  Food: 10/10 the taste is so tasty, i got the french kiss crepes with everything in it(nutella-my favorite, strawberries and organic banana) from scratch!   Service: Friendly  staff, i even met with the owner, he gave me a 25% discount which i wasn't expecting:-)

EqeHgWM9a5JCWGe58ECsHw.text: Just went here for the 2nd time with my girlfriend. Awesome spot! The food both times has been perfect! Sat outside on the patio today and enjoyed the weather. Will definitely be coming back more!

rQmV6afxa3fI8AxLU4zwIA.text: This place was absolutely fabulous. The staff was warm and welcoming. The menu had so many options with a yummy twist on certain dishes. The Hawaiian sweet bread french toast with guava cream cheese and coconut syrup was amazing. I will definitely make a point to eat here again next time I am in Las Vegas.

hUeC4dHRwcjQJGGw4x1J6g.text: Really great breakfast spot! The avocado toast with salmon was amazing along with with fresh squeezed orange juice!!

VJ2wbBHmAMhZLe3HnlkbPw.text: The food is always amazing and very fresh. My fiance and I love trying new things on the menu. It's always really good! Definitely our new brunch spot:)

28rqF0TdGrI7XXthFvrBww.text: In my book, the company EAT 24 is mostly at fault.  But when you use a third party to deliver your food, the experience should be somewhat carried over.  Now I never ate here before. And i still haven't.  I ordered my food today at 1pm for delivery.  The app EAT 24 said the food would be picked up and out for delivery 10-30 min after food was ready.  My food was not delivered until 4pm.  By then i had to go to work and get food elsewhere.   It was quite upsetting.  When the food finally came, the delivery guy made it seem like because my roommate received the food 3 hours later all was forgiven.  I ordered food with enough time to have it prepped, delivered, and eaten. The food arrived inedible, old, and soggy. My roomie ended up receiving 3 hour old breakfast burritos and pancakes that were held in a sweat box of a person's car, who has no business doing deliveries.   Just because you have a car and a license doesn't mean you are qualified to deliver food or drive in a city you don't know well.  And because of this person's careless and disrespectful ways.  I am harshly reviewing EAT 24 and the Dirty Fork.  If you choose to have people deliver your food, better have them know the area. I spent 24$ plus tip and received a headache, and no food before work and i had to settle on fast food instead. By the time i could follow up.  We were promised 30% off but a full refund is what i am asking for from someone.

_VtkamINuZS1o95v8bQ5iw.text: This place is amazing and so refreshing. The staff and the owner (and chef) are friendly and attentive, and the food is incredibly good. Their French fries are a must try!

UWIJfSb7qLzow8BiczhFcg.text: Great food amazing service found a new diamond in the rough here in Las Vegas just so been 10 days ago their food is amazing Great presentation everyone here is super friendly place you can come to on a regular basis really affordable prices bon appetit

xBTrt0oG4HQQ0K84tOm0Kg.text: Lovely breakfast. The staff was very attentive. Beautiful surroundings and yummy food! I can't wait to come back

photos.caption: Photo of Dirty Fork - Las Vegas, NV, United States

zJ1H4R46YnzBjqEIF4si7A.text: Unfortunately, we won't be back. Two of three times we've dined here, the service has been horrendous. The menu here is awesome, so my family of four gave it another whirl, but our most recent visit was absolutely awful. A table that arrived after us (another group of four) were seated, served, presented their check, paid their bill and left before we got our food. They sent food out for 3 of 4 people at the table with no explanation on the missing plate, which we had to wait another 15 minutes for. Of the three meals that came out, all three were wrong- one set of poached eggs were undercooked and tasted strongly of vinegar, another meal was doused in sauce we ordered it without, and blueberry pancakes were raw in the center and oozed batter when we cut into them. The waitress, who was very apologetic and moderately embarrassed, returned the bad meals to the kitchen. While waiting for the second round of food, the manager came over and we shared what was happening, asking about the still missing fourth meal. She apologized and offered a free dessert, which we declined. About ten minutes later, we got new pancakes (which were good), and replacements for the other two meals. Of these, one set of poached eggs was over cooked (completely hard). The fourth meal was still missing at this point, and my son was nearly in tears. His food showed up another 5-10 minutes later, and by now we were ready to just leave. The waitress checked on us again, and was sympathetic when we asked for our bill so we could go. Shockingly, after all this, the manager didn't remove or reduce any charges on the $70 check. Unbelievably disappointing experience.

TYVc2UXFsjwp9HjHhVL41A.text: Ok so, this place.... went in it was full House. Cute decor and we were seated right away. We were really excited about the looks of the Menu. As we sat there waiting for our order to be taken we watched beautiful dish after dish being served. Dish after dish after dish after dish after dish after dish.... no one came to take even our drink order. Finally, a bus boy brought us water. Then again we watched dish after dish.... finally about 30 minuets later our order was taken. Best fresh squeezed orange juice! But after 45 minuets later.... after the mad rush of 17 soccer players were long gone, and a second glass of the best orange juice had been delivered (hoped it was on the house at this point) we continued to watch dish after dish after dish being served to others. The Chef came to apologize. We then continued to wait. We almost walked out and then my dish came. I felt bad to eat because my boyfriend did not get his. Mine looked good ish. It was their signature breakfast. Way too expensive for that dish. We had a Groupon so I splurged to get it. Finally, my boyfriend got his food. But, for as long as we waited and the waitress said it was not her fault and out of her hands.... then why the hell did my boyfriend have to get up to get ketchup. I mean you had an hour and a half to bring us ketchup for the fries that was ordered. Chef came back with a piece of bread pudding as a good Will Offering. We checked out. My second juice was not charged and they did not let us use the Groupon for it was a weekend. We had check in on yelp but did not get to have the free soda. What a fucking waist of time and money. I gave them 3 stars, because I know they will reach out to me and offer to give me a $100 gift card to their place and show me how they could do better then today and earn five stars. I have faith in them.

3t0WtIaZfx9caEMHZ1Lqwg.text: I'm just moving into the neighborhood and thought I'd check this place out. It surprised me it was so good! The food was above par, the service was wicked friendly, and it's adorable. And the view of the park is nice. Good pastries, fresh squeezed juice! And macarons! Omg I want to come every day!

gw3_9bww3CxbcFEO91HVng.text: Definitely unique food that are very beautifully displayed. Will continue to return here until I'm able to have said I've tried everything on their menu! - also, a very chill vibe! Love it!

photos.caption: Photo of Dirty Fork - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Vegas style avocado toast and the tomato basil with grilled cheese!

tM4BhxfN_laLmXUApYkC1A.text: Excellent food and excellent service. Get the waffles and chicken. They are amazing! Also the smoked salmon poached egg was incredible.

xPdPimpzHL2o9KIHqyWm6w.text: Kj was a super cool server! Owner was really nice came over to check on us to make sure everything was tasting good. Beautiful presentation and everything tasted absolutely amazing. Will definitely be back!

photos.caption: Photo of Dirty Fork - Las Vegas, NV, United States

o8_Tu477upgVWEQW07I2_w.text: Amazing food! Fairly surprised by the Dirty Fork Breakfast special. A unique combo but works soooo good together. We also got the breakfast Sammy sandwich and that was delicious!!! Def will be regulars here!

p1wxOSxVGG1m27_Ybx0DIQ.text: My wife and I visit Vegas about 4 times per year and always rent a car because we enjoy seeing more of the city than The Strip & Fremont Street. This new (opened early this year) breakfast and lunch spot is a little out of the way but worth the trip. The staff and owner are extremely friendly and the food they prepare is top notch at a reasonable price. My wife's egg white omelette and my bacon & scrambled eggs were both top notch. The service was quick and attentive. The owner pointed out that the hardest part of launching a new dining spot is making people aware you're there. From experience, I can say with certainty that once discovered, they will have no difficulty in seeing repeat business. Oh, and the forks are sparkling clean

AWyvqKySbSaeWe5ejmZdeQ.text: 3 star only because Food was delicious. But service as far as service I would have given no stars...it was horrible. I waited at least 15 mins before even getting ask what I would like to drink. Then I had to wait another 15 mins before drinks came out. What upset me was 1. The place wasn't too busy. Maybe 3/4 tables tops. 2. How is it that I've been waiting to be served for the last half hr and the table next to me gets served first? 3. I guess I was served short on one of my plates. Half way through my meal the waitress comes out with a side dish and says "here's an extra side dish because we shorted you on your plate". Seriously?!?! Again food was great but service was horrible

whW2VvKGkHzJeqBj8LX6xg.text: Wonderful food and amazing service! The best fries in Vegas, and even the simplest meals like a grilled cheese or burger is packed with flavor. Highly recommend this place!

rD_VBrVaTmwd3oFhg3U_-A.text: I would not go back there after learning what happens "behind the scenes" They do not practice good health code standards. Using bare hands to make food, not to mention a friend of mine who used to work there had found "clean" plates with blood dried on them!!! MORE THAN ONE!! HUGE RED FLAG! It is a shame since I have had a good experience the first time I ate there. Aside from potential health risks, they do not treat their employees well, underpaid and under appreciated. I cannot support a business that does not see the value in good service to their customers AND staff. I suppose I shouldn't be surprised considering it's named The DIRTY fork...not far off there.

u5DFXsTPSKazs9OXlMXh7A.text: Just bought a groupon, and tried this place for the first time. It's right down the street from me, great location. The decor is perfect, great ambiance, service was wonderful, and the food was amazing! We ordered the Dirty Fork breakfast special and the Angus burger. The chicken on the special was awesome, the burger was seasoned perfectly, fries were so good, and for me the biggest surprise were the eggs. I don't eat other people's eggs very often, but these were seasoned well, and tasted amazing. Also, the fresh squeezed orange juice was sweet and delicious, some of the best I've ever had. I would highly recommend this place, and will definitely be back soon.

ONnNASiVOhKxnxVrxNOnhg.text: First time here - always looking for a good breakfast place and I think I found one! Interesting menu (both breakfast and lunch) - healthy choices with a Hawaiian flavor. Their omelette was delicious- light and fluffy, and comes with a small green salad if you want instead of hash browns. The dining room is open with lots of tables as well as a counter. Overall a nice addition to my breakfast dining choices!

gN5HD2jtOl1rRfAzoL9nyw.text: I really enjoy coming to this cafe. The atmosphere is so relaxed and along with the calming music.  KJ our server was great. He was very polite and approachable.  The Vegas Avocado toast is my favorite dish here.  If you need a quiet place for breakfast to start your day off right come to this venue. You won't be disappointed.

K0oOrvXP3o8P_6ooeFn_Ow.text: I am always for a new brunch experience!  FOOD: The presentation of their dishes are pretty. The Happy Hippie Kale Salad was a refreshing salad served with an avocado dressing. I was not a fan of the dressing, but the salad itself was refreshing made with quality ingredients. I was really excited to try the Ms. Lorraine Quiche. The bacon, cheese, and egg was cooked perfectly and literally melted in my mouth. My only thing was it was cold when it was served to me and I did not like the crust at all. I prefer my quiche to be more flaky in texture. The Tomato Soup and Grilled Cheese is always a must order everywhere I go. But unfortunately, it was also cold by the time it was served to me. The soup was decent, but I was not too crazy about the grilled cheese, I think it was the type of bread used. The food is good, but I think they should work on their recipes a bit more.  BAKERY: The owners seem to focus on recommending customers their bakery items more than their menu items. The macaroons were delicious and I highly recommend trying them. Their croissants and almond croissants were okay, but I wasn't too crazy about it. They were a bit hard for croissants.  DRINK: They serve the basic coffee, latte, and tea items you would want for brunch. Nothing too special. Water is served in a glass bottle.  ATMOSPHERE: This restaurant is a cross between a casual and fancy coffee shop. I have to say the service was great. Our waiter was really friend and attentive. I love the look of the place with the bright blue walls and shiny floors.

q_FgXhM7pfDfR5nRq4Yxiw.text: My boyfriend and I came in here for brunch after I saw so many delicious pictures on social media  So we couldn't resist since we love exploring Vegas's favorite local spots.   I got their avocado toast (I can't go anywhere without trying any place's avo toast for some reason) & a 9th Island French Toast which were both delicious. The avocado was only 1 slice of wheat toast with a lot of greens, 2 poached eggs & the avocado spread of course. You can get it with smoked salmon & cream cheese if you'd like as well. The French toast was 3 slices of sweet Hawaiian bread with fruit & very yummy coconut syrup.   My SO got a side of bacon, hash browns, & 2 eggs & a Take Me to Belgian Waffles with fruit & he expected more than just 1 Belgian waffle..   We both got coffee & everything tasted great. But we didn't expect our brunch bill to come out to almost $60.. for it to fill our stomachs contently. I recommend to not order sides to prevent it from being costly.   Come to Dirty Fork, the taste & presentation is absolutely amazing! So if you're willing to spend a little more out of pocket to try everything, it will be worth it.

pPjw2-0qkiSp1O1Kqi29lQ.text: A great find on my short trip to Vegas!  The scene is open, bright. Mid day during the week, no reservation required. We were there for lunch. Party of 8.   The menu is fun with a pretty wide range of choices including sandwiches, salads, bowls, wraps but also charcuteri and bruschetta.   Service was pleasant and quick.   VEGAS STYLE AVOCADO TOAST $11.50 The dish was meant to be made with smoked salmon which was not available and was substituted with Prosciutto. A bit of a disappointment but the dish was still fantastic. Fresh greens and Prosciutto piled on avocado toast and topped off with a glorious poached egg..   The coffee was fresh and delicious!   Other dishes had by our party looked equally yummy and were reported to be excellent. No one in this crowd would hesitate to return!  This is a great stop for breakfast or lunch.

oH7vmEel9c0QGsTLwMR01g.text: I wasn't quite sure to expect from this place when I saw the name and then the chic-style updates the did from the prior restaurant that was in the same spot. I was pleasantly surprised to see an eclectic breakfast/lunch menu that includes both some gourmet touches mixed with a good balance of more traditional food options.   Deciding on the 9th Island French Toast, I was looking forward to a delicious experience. While good, the french toast fell short of expectations. It was not remotely as sweet or sumptuous as I would expect from standard french toast at any other breakfast place. The fruit offered at an additional cost was also nothing significant, though aesthetically on point, and was essentially room temperature. Particularly for the price ($13.75 with The fruit add), I certainly expected something more memorable. I also was not offered a glass or ice for my can of diet coke. Seems strange, but not a huge issue for me.   All that being said, the food was decent and I will definitely return to try some of the other intriguing items on the menu to see if I better connect with a different item. The service itself was fast and the food was attractively plated. A gentleman, who I assume is the owner or at least manager, did stop by after my meal to check on me. He seemed concerned with the flavor, which makes me wonder if they have had complaints. I will say that I did not raise my concern at that time because overall everything was decent and they may intentionally be trying to downplay the sweetness of the dish. He also requested a review if I used Yelp, which is always a positive sign for a brand new restaurant.

McYQFwlgrTwU-0S0OCv6zQ.text: We decided to try a new brunch spot after our fave Andre's bistro closed down. I had vaguely heard about dirty fork so decided to give it a try. Talk about a seriously wise decision. The food here is fantastic and they have an expansive menu all the way from spam musubis to French macarons!  The eatery is very casual with spacious tables catering best to parties of any size. We had the fatty burrito (fantastic with crispy bacon), the Paris panini (delish), and the avocado toast (one of the best!). I also threw on a spam musubi and a dozen macarons (to take home) for good measure.  We'll be back for sure to try more brunch items.  Plus they have a dog-friendly patio! win win win!

kAV13H7M-YbKTKTaSOp9hg.text: Solid breakfast and lunch spot on the West side of town. My most recent visit was during a 3 hour wait time at the DMV down the road and decided to use Yelp to try out a new place to eat at since I had so much time before the DMV would call me up. Dirty Fork was previously bookmarked in my profile but I left it in my bookmarked section for awhile and remember seeing a few delicious looking posts from various Yelpers.   Upon arrival, I was greeted by Maggie and was seated promptly and given a Menu. She was quite knowledgeable of what is offered. It took me some time to decide what I wanted but I ended up with an order of the 9th Island French Toast with fresh fruits. When it arrived, I was like, "Aloha!" It was so big and filing. The actual Toast is made with Hawaiian Sweet Bread and was paired well with the Guava Cream Cheese. Every bite was scrumptious and mouth watering. I would come back for this if I wanted to an order of carb overload, lol. Great to share with someone or needing a delicious cheat day. Kudos to Jose, the cook for the Day. I wanted to try a few items but they were out of certain ingredienta so I was quite bum. However, I will come back to try more of their delicious food and if im feeling home sick. Mahalo Dirty Fork!  2018 Yelp Review #42

kX3GQDZTgL7A9EmpRnqNsA.text: First time here and the service was horrendous. It seems the servers don't know about their own menu since they have to hold it to their face and read off what's on there.   They also charge $2.50 extra for "egg whites only" (for a dish that already includes eggs) because they use some expensive stuff from a carton. I asked them if they can just use regular egg and separate it from that since my dish already included eggs and the server agreed. Since we had to wait a while to put in the order I decided to time them to see how long it will take my order to come out. About 10 minutes later a staff member comes out and tells me they don't do that and absolutely have to use some previously separated egg white.   There is an obvious lack of communication between the staff and also, you should stick with one lie with either the egg white being from a carton or being previously separated by a staff. Not both. How sketchy.   I'm not sure why it took 10 minutes to tell me for a staff to tell me they can't serve my food when half the restaurant was empty. But I can say with confidence that all the horrible reviews on their service are absolutely correct!

UnY98d-8qlm18i8eGG-c0w.text: I've been here twice now. My first review was a 4 because I  thought their food was good  and the service was okay. They messed up our order once  Today we went again and were seated at the table ( middle of the room). My boyfriend and one of daughters went out for brunch. We ordered breakfast: a belgian waffle for my daughter with orange juice, I got the goddess bowl( yogurt, fruit and granola) and a bagel with cream cheese and orange juice,  my boyfriend got a Belgian waffle, 2 eggs over medium, hash browns, veggie sausage and an orange juice and a coffer. We weren't given water. The guy( I'm assuming manager of sorts-not friendly) brings over a pineapple filled with rice and shrimp, and a Belgian waffle, and we're like that's not ours- we kept the Belgian waffle for our daughter. What we don't understand was why only 1 was given to us and we ordered 2.  He goes back to whatever he's telling the cooks. He comes back 10 minutes later with one dish that had eggs but bacon and something else. I'm pissed at this point- should've walked out. He comes back with the wrong food the third time. Seriously WTF and every  other table got the right stuff.  I swear that stupid table is cursed. Our food finally trickled in as we repeated everything we ordered multiple times. I got a bagel and they messed it up- at least to me. Plain bagel with cream cheese  ended up being a burnt bagel with some weird concoction of their interpretation of cream cheese- don't try it. The cream cheese stayed solid it was weird and gross.  We finally asked the for water and the guy brought us over a jug of water- no glasses. I guess we'll drink the water like a 40 . We're classy and all. The other food was pretty good though. We got our bill after they took off my bagel. It was $62. WTF. Apparently our orange juice alone was $15 for 3 tiny glasses. Eating breakfast at a little place shouldn't cost that much for 2 adults and an 11 year old. I am so disappointed . Don't  expect us back there. I don't recommend it for anyone.   Sorry for no pics this time I didn't have my phone on me.
