FtntVYMQp-2k9ChmHEarLg.text: I was so disappointed not to enjoy a better experience at Dirty Fork.   I originally heard about this business after following their Facebook page since they advertised their pet friendly patio, as well as a drink promotion for bringing your pet along. Also, after my news feed was 'bombarded' with photos of delicious-looking Hawaiian-infused American brunch plates, it was about time to see what all the fuss was about!  I arrived here on a Saturday late morning for some brunch with friends, this time without the pup. As one friend was already there, I took a seat and immediately regretted wearing a sweater rather than layering in this winter weather - the heating in there feels like you're actually in Hawaii! Phewwww!  It took a while for a server to arrive, but when she did, we ordered some drinks and food. I couldn't decide between the afternoon tea or the Vegas Style Avocado toast, but the server quickly advised me that the pastries that come with the tea weren't fresh that day.  I appreciated the honesty, but was a little taken aback when she told my table that I would like the Avocado toast because I "looked like I like avocado and seem the type to like a pretty plate". I wasn't too sure I knew what she was getting at or where she'd assumed my food habits from after seeing me for all of 10 seconds. Not sure on how to respond to a stereotypical (and slightly insulting) remark, I just said 'ok' and we waited on our food.  This again took some time, as did one of our orange juices that was forgotten about, but after 20-30 minutes, plates arrived.  The avocado toast was presented well with a variety of different colours, textures and flavours to enjoy and it was plentiful for a brunch/breakfast dish. Digging in though, I was a little disappointed that the smoked salmon wasn't very fresh and had that slight texture and acidic taste to it after some time too long sat in the fridge. The blueberries were also going soft, so I picked the ones that seemed fresh enough to eat.  By the end, I was pretty full and didn't want to risk giving anything else a try at risk of it not being totally fresh or that the server would have an opinion on what I ordered, so we asked for the bill.  I presented the free soda Yelp check-in offer for a soda my friend had ordered, but was disappointed to find that despite not seeing any restrictions on the offer, I could not redeem on the weekend.  We were however given another flier for a free coffee with any meal, but again, despite no mention on the flier itself, was told by the server, only weekdays, so bare this in mind if you have a coupon to present!  Overall, underwhelming. Dirty Fork seems to have so much potential and the concepts and craft behind each dish are unique and seemingly delicious. I just felt they fell short on my visit here.

TNWWy5gzLv-J4aW3HKSa8Q.text: The food was below average. My girlfriend and I got French toast, a croissant sandwich with eggs bacon and cheese, and a side of hash browns. The French toast was ok except for the fact that it was on the mushy side. I would have preferred it to be more fluffy than mushy, and more of a crisp on the outside. The croissant sandwich was ok, but the hash browns were bad. They weren't crispy, and didn't taste fresh, they tasted like the ones in the super market from the frozen section.  The real issue was with the service. Firstly, the table was way too small. Everything was really crowded and we had to pay attention throughout the meal to try to watch our elbows and not knock anything over. My girlfriend ended up knocking her fork over by accident so we were trying to get the waitresses attention to get a new one, but she never came over. I ended up giving my girlfriend my fork and having to eat with my hands the French toast with syrup and get my hands all dirty. She also never brought us the napkins we requested, and was confused about whether the guac comes with onions or tomatoes.  Still, the biggest issue ended up being with the payment. We had a Groupon that we told the waitress about in the beginning. When we went to pay, they said they wouldn't accept it because it was a weekend. It may have been in the fine print somewhere, but it certainly wasn't made clear to us. Putting things in fine print to deceive a customer into buying something that they otherwise wouldn't buy is not the right thing to do, and indicates that you're not confident in your product (in this case food).  We went to pay and they redeemed the groupon such that it was taken from our Groupon balance, but they wouldn't take the money off of the bill. So now we had to lose the money we paid to Groupon, and not get the discount in return. We argued with a manager for about ten minutes at the table, because THEY made the mistake of redeeming our Groupon even though they don't accept them on weekends. Other people were watching, but he was very stubborn and wouldn't budge. Very bad experience for us, but at the end of the day, probably a more harmful experience for them in lost business.

-uN2bsTLC4WZoecXXEnMyw.text: I'd advise if you want to try this place and get the full experience, you might have a better time going in. Well we tried to see what this place is all about and decided to get delivery. After waiting an hour and a half we called to rudely be told that the food is ready now and on its way. 30 minutes later we call Grubhub and they stated the restaurant said they're too busy and on its way now. If you have enough time to inform Grubhub that you're too busy, then inform the customer that's waiting patiently. You just put it in order of how the order comes in and if you can't handle that, then don't advertise you get order delivery though Grubhub, Postmates, UberEats and Eat24. We are currently still waiting on cold food as they said they were 5 minutes, 12 minutes ago.

UW7-ArAaDoi1EyR9KpFVbA.text: Best coffee in town! Turkish coffee that doesnt even need any additives. Food is delicious and service is fast and friendly.

2TvKwQm83vxnZIogQQrKKw.text: I've been here about 5 times. They have totally messed up the orders of me and/or my party on two occasions already. These mess ups include taking forever to bring out an item from the bakery case, then finding they were out, as well as cooking orders wrong then doing it over wrong again, to over seasoning the food. Also, even though the food items generally taste very good and look beautiful, the pricing is pretty steep for the amount of food. After the last set of mistakes, I was given multiple coupons for the future which is one of the reasons I came back today with my parents. As they made a few more mistakes w the food today, I was even more disappointed to hear that the owner will no longer honor the free coffee coupon or the 10% off which were given as a result of their prior mistakes (and which had no expiration date on them).  The place is never busy which I like and the servers are very friendly and accommodating, but the policies at this place and ownership are not so great. Honestly, as much as I enjoy the calm island atmosphere, I am not sure that I will come back.

JwnbF9D2Yrk-oyjHGTFuvA.text: Came to this place based on ratings..won't do that again.  The place was nice, but the service was very slow and the food overpriced and nothing to rave about.  It took like 20 min or so to get regular coffee  and the owner comes over to us apologizing and says that the coffee will be free and that he just opened the place 2 or 3 weeks ago and doesn't have enough servers.  When I ordered the crepes with nutella, one with banana and one without, I was told by the waitress that she wasn't going to tell the cooks that because they were so busy and it was going to make them mad, that she could tell them to put the banana on the side.  The place was not even at full capacity, and there certainly wasn't a crowd waiting for a table.   And they still didn't get the order right anyway!  My instinct was to get up and go but I decided to let it slide.  I ordered the Vegas Style Toast and it simply was not good.  The poached eggs were still kind of raw and were totally bland.  It grossed me out so I had the waitress take it.  I decided to only order a bagel instead of a new full dish because of how long it took to get our food in the first place.  Even that took like 10 minutes!  My son's hash browns with onions were burned and  he said that the crepes we make at home were better.  I tried the omelette my husband ordered and we agreed that wasn't good either.  When it came time to pay the bill the Vegas Toast had not been removed.  I asked the waitress about it and she said that her boss said we still had to pay for it.  I was obviously not happy with having to pay for a dish that was so disgusting to me.  I took my kids and went to wait for my husband in the car I was so pist.  When my husband comes out he says he told the owner that I didn't like what I got and the owner responded by saying that I didn't like a lot of things, that I wasn't in the mood.   What a professional!  Don't try to pin on me the fact that the food and service was so damn shitty!  This guy clearly has no experience in the food business and much less in customer service!  I doubt this place will be open for long.  Even the waitress told my husband that it wasn't right that we had to pay for the dish.  The one star for this place is too much!

XLIj6IkrWEivaCKY-V61rw.text: went to breakfast this am with a group of 8.  service was great.  food was presented well and it tasted great.  will come back.

mzPwaNK71g6xc_9oMekmXw.text: Well before I start, let me say that with great fortune, I am able to dine at so many of the Michelin star places on a regular places from Rubicon in Paris to Il mullno in Manhattan to Providence in Los Angeles and so many in Vegas including Nobu, Gordon Ramsey ( EWWW) , Giada, Alize', SW, Guy savoy and on and on . It is also out of necessity cause my lovely wife do not like the sight of a cook top, I was told it causes a rash of some sort and I believe it as it puts her in a odd mood all day when she does enter the room called kitchen! She saw this place one day and suggest we go there and give it a try as that is our hobby living in Vegas to try any place we have not been before at home or when we travel. Sometimes it is a fantastic surprise and sometimes it is a disaster. The chef/owner came and introduce himself and told us he was at the Wynn for 10 years and that sets me up to have high expectations. I am pleased to say, it does not disappoints as the room is cute and pleasant with a nice park view, parking is abundant and the food is great! Fruit is fresh and the croissant is as good as any in Paris, all the little things are done right, the egg in my croissant is slightly browned and portions are good for humans but not gluttons so don't expect a feeding trough but a civilized portion! Tomato soup is note worthy, perfect balance of flavor and texture, it is common to be over salted and this one is not. Coffee is good and hot and the dessert which we took home was a very nice surprise for a breakfast place, is it as good as Angelina  in Paris? Certainly not as elaborate but for what they do make, comparable and that is a high praise if you ever been to Angelina in Paris. In finally, we will be back with friends and I honestly do think one thing they can do and that is to raise the price a little, for what they serve, they deserve a few more dollars, that is what I think of this place, enough said.

D6fpjFkrIF0e3WkfyAcnfg.text: I always have a good time coming here. Food is great and the employees are really nice. Everyone has their bad days so don't let some reviews knock this place down!

ghwHpLYOME8D-pKSJ4BYEw.text: Tried this place after a recommendation from a friend.  It wasn't busy.  We were seated right away by a friendly server.  We went with the Hilo Loco Moco, Eggs Benedict, and Hawaiian Style pancakes.  All were very good, but the stand out was the Eggs Benedict.  The macaroni salad that cake with the Loco Moco was the best I've ever had.  The server said it was made in-house.  The pastries looked really good, but we didn't try any this time.  We'll be back tho.

fddwu0ZpQyDJ1n9PLLbEmA.text: This place is beyond cute and adorable. Upon entrance it almost seemingly appears that you are no longer in vegas. The aesthetic & decorum of the entire place was very alluring, although the service - not so much....   My friend and I entered the store around 1:02, we got seated and waited. It took about 10 mins for the someone to realize we did not have any menus and have been waiting for someone to come help us. We our waters a couple minutes later and order our food within 20 mins of arrival. It was extremely busy during the time we went. My friend and I literally waited almost an hour afterwards for our food (which I have no complaints about). There was only TWO chefs working and cooking all the food for everyone and it took extremely long. I was certainly not expecting to wait so long for average tasting food. This was such a hinderance on my time.   Not only that but my other friend order an acai bowl and it literally came out like soup!! with barely any fruit or granola or anything to mask the horrid taste. For $11.50 it was certainly not worth every penny. Although I do thank management for giving her extra honey, extra granola, and extra fruit - because girl let me tell you that acai bowl was well very bland.   I will most likely not come again. It was a very cute restaurant with a lot of potential, although they definitely need to work on time management and hire some more chefs!!!

cMOmS49IMl0zHrj3nqMJkQ.text: Talk about nice little breakfast/brunch spot off the strip. I always wanted to check out Dirty Fork because honest the name does peak one interest. More so close to the house for me and always looking for new spots nearby. My first impression was talk about REALLY really nice interior decor. I know the place before was also breakfast/lunch spot but am sure not as nice. The display case with the fresh pastries is on point! The different pastries all looked hell of tasty just had no room for any once realize the size of the 9th island french toast. Three different areas in the restaurant. The bar area once walk in that had all these different cool light fixtures hanging down, the main dining area, and in the back little booth area that has really cool framed artwork hanging on the wall. The whole Dirty Fork name and big Fork on another wall. I like the personality in it. They do have some outdoor patio available.   9th island French Toast was screaming at me for first visit. I know just cause from 808. Really when reading the description the key was "Hawaiian Sweet Bread". It something that not see often on menus in general. Who would have thought basic French Toast concept but use Hawaiian Sweet Bread. Brilliant! Not only the Toast but add the guava cream cheese and coconut syrup went tropical island style. I added fresh fruit (Strawberries and Blueberries) not only more filling but balances out all the flavors. Talk about nice portion size if carbs is the game you get your money worth on this one. lol. It was winnah!  I also ordered fresh orange juice. The only reason mention it is that they squeeze juice everyday. You can tell the difference. Super refreshing and perfect drink with my breakfast.   The service was five stars. The waiter told him first time explaining everything checking up  making sure everything was great. The owner is awesome. I love seeing small business owners out in the dining room asking for feedback on the food. Honest. Friendly. Grateful. Genuine. Someone that not only has passion for the food but cares about customers.   The prices are very reasonable. If looking for great spot start the day Dirty Fork is great spot! Or if any your plans involves Desert Breeze Park head across the street for food later.

Hgyx9qaoQdVsD7Fs0R2hnA.text: I've been wanting to try this place out for a while and today I ran upon their deal on Groupon so I felt like that was a sign that it was finally time to try it out! We came in around 11:30am and were seated right away. I really enjoyed the interior and decor of the restaurant, I felt like it was very cute and quaint which is the perfect design for a breakfast/brunch place! :) The menus have two sides - one side for breakfast and the other for lunch. There were a variety of options which made it hard to choose but we decided to go for the "Fatty Burrito" and the "Dirty Fork Lunch Special." I subbed the bacon on the breakfast burrito for turkey bacon and salad instead of fresh fruit on the side and my bf subbed his side for hash browns with onions (which was phenomenal!).   Our food took a while to come out considering the fact there was only two other tables in the restaurant but our server was super friendly and kept refilling our waters and reassuring us that our food would be out soon. I wasn't entirely impressed with the burrito and halfway while I was eating I noticed that I didn't get my pico de gallo that comes with it, but the server was able to bring me out a side of it immediately. my bf's entree was very delicious! It consisted of salmon, poached eggs, mushrooms, veggies, and butter on top of a whole grain toast - definitely recommend to try this dish!   Overall, it was a good first time experience. The owner came around making sure we were enjoying our food and at the end, even gave us a flyer that gives us two free coffees on our next visit, yay!

lK69fMBhpNXdoeY2eYFeLw.text: There are so many great places to eat breakfast in SW LV -- and while the food was really pretty delicious (although really expensive for what you got), we witnessed several violations of what would be considered inappropriate food handling. For instance, the  sliding door for the reach in cooler where the pastries are kept was left open for the entire hour that we were eating -- because they were also storing raw eggs for the brunch service in that case as well. I'm fairly sure that you're not supposed to store raw poultry/uncooked eggs next to uncovered ready-to-serve food. What's more, it was a hot Las Vegas summer day -- with the entire door open and a tower of probably 100 eggs just sitting there in convenient reach for the cook, you can't convince me that those eggs were being kept at a safe temperature. I watched the staff with this reach in too -- keeping the door open must be standard operating procedure for them because they never ONCE shut the door, which would be a habit/muscle memory for those servers if it were normally closed. To make matters worse, there were tons of flies in the restaurant, which is a huge warning sign that garbage is not being removed/floors are not being cleaned properly -- that many flies inside a restaurant means that they had/have maggots somewhere. And even grosser-- those flies were happily hanging out in the pastry case thanks to the open door. This is but one violation that I witnessed -- in that short time there, I saw a waitress move from touching cash to pulling toast and buttering it (touching it with her hands) without stopping to wash her hands. If these simple habits that are so public aren't being followed, can you imagine how bad the areas you can't see are?  It's too bad -- the food really was tasty.

tedkiSdC_o1K2J0fCh3O5A.text: Is this place French? Am I crazy? Dirty Fork doesn't sound like a french name but the vibes are definitely french, not to mention the menu has items that have clearly french names. It's just that the name "Dirty Fork" didn't make me think "french bistro." Which also means that I was not prepared for the higher than average pricing. I ordered a Paris Panini and it was good but nothing special. I replaced the salad with hashbrowns and those were bomb! They cook them with onion and I didn't even need ketchup to enjoy them. My boyfriend got the Dirty Fork Breakfast Special. He liked it but I didn't even try it because I really was not in the mood for chicken.  I think the shock of thinking it would be something it wasn't turned off my boyfriend from it, but I will certainly come back. I enjoyed my time and learning about what this place offers. The portions are  smaller than other comparable restaurants but I thought it was perfect sizing. It was enough to eat everything and feel full but not so much that I felt sick or had to take some home. I was particularly impressed by their coffee! I am by no means a coffee snob, I can be equally satisfied by 7/11 brew as LavAzza but this was smooth and perfect even without creamer.   Will be back!

jQGqeSod9Nq-NA3BYPEgiA.text: I was REALLY looking forward to dining at The Dirty Fork. 3 girlfriends and I decided to meet here for our monthly breakfast date. We had a groupon to use and were excited when we looked at the menu.   We arrived when there was only two other tables occupied so it was lovely and quiet. The server greeted us but immediately seemed frazzled just getting us water.   My 3 year old son tagged along as well and I asked for an orange juice for him, to which she replied, "Well that will be a little while because I have to squeeze it and everything." Okkkkk....was she trying to convince me not to get it? Then I said, "Ok, do you have kids sizes? It's just for my little guy." She started walking away and said, "No we have one size. It's five dollars so, it doesn't matter who orders it."   Then came the ordering of other drinks. She came back and asked what we'd like. I told her I was fine with water. My friend across from me asked for orange juice, which she again told us it would be a bit since she had to squeeze it. Then my other friend ordered an iced coffee (which is on the menu), to which the server responded, "We don't have cappuccino or anything, we're basically out of everything today. We didn't get our delivery." My friend told her, "That's fine I just wanted regular iced coffee." She said, "Ok I don't have beans or anything." So my friend said, "So do you have coffee?" and the server said, "Yeah I can make regular iced coffee." ........?!?!?!?!?!?!?? Then my next friend asked for a latte....oh brother, the server was clearly pissed now. She said, "I don't have stuff for lattes. Do you just want water?" My friend said, "What are your assorted teas?" (Listed that way on the menu) and the server said, "We have green tea and English breakfast." My friend told her she'd have English breakfast with lemon, and the server said, "Not honey? Usually it comes with honey."   Ok, moving on to food. We ordered and had no issues ordering the food, all of which was fantastic. The saving grace of this place was the food was fantastic.   Now it's time to pay. I thought her head might explode. We told her about the Groupon in the beginning but she brought the check without taking it off, so my friend said, "Oh you forgot the Groupon" and she said, "Oh well you know you shouldve reminded me."  She then looked at the paper printout my friend brought and said, "Can't you pull it up on your phone so i can redeem it immediately? Otherwise we have to send it in and it's a big pain for him." ("Him" being the owner, i presume?) My friend tried to pull it up but was not getting service in the restaurant so the server (tapping her fingers on the table) said, "Ugh I'll just take this. I just don't want it to kick back to him that it doesn't work." Then she took it and came back with the adjusted check and we handed her our credit cards asking her to split it 4 ways evenly. She said, "Oh I cant Split the check or the Groupon won't work." I said, "Oh we're not splitting it, we're just paying with multiple forms of payment. That shouldn't matter." She said, "No I can't. You'll have to pay for it with one form of payment." As a former waitress, I was floored by her behavior and terrible service up to this point but this response was laughable. Finally I decided to just pay for it and we had to get it figured out how much each owed and how to Venmo it. All while my newborn was screaming.   Time to go. We said goodbye to each other and as I went to grab my son, the server snatched the paybook off the table which caused my keys to fall. As I'm holding my car seat in my arm and my sons hand with my other arm, she didn't even pick them up.   Bottom line, as a diner, I don't care one bit what you're out of or why, what inconvenience you might incur because of a coupon program YOU participated in, the fact that you only have ONE server and by the time we left there were 8 tables of people, or the mood of said server because she's dealing with all these issues.   They say you come for the food but you come back for the service. I WILL NEVER COME BACK TO THIS PLACE. For $5 per glass of juice, and $12.50 for 2 tiny Nutella crepes with one spoonful of whipped cream, you better be kissing my ass, and this was a joke.

fkKiwmv5bNEbliJHlmd79g.text: I came when they opened and haven't been back, until today. New restaurants always have a few kinks to work out and I'm surprised they're still working on that...  I think it's important that all employees are aware of and practice safe food handling. After ordering an orange juice I watched our server head to the back bar and use her hands to put ice in the mason jar style cups. I sent my husband over to ask her to serve mine sans ice. I've also never had a fries squeezed OJ served with ice sooo there's that. The juice came from a pitcher in the fridge so although I'm positive it is fresh squeezed, I am sure the ice is not for temperature purposes.   It seems like they penny pinch here. Between icing the OJ and charging $2 for a hash brown sub (instead of the greens served with the omelette).   I ordered the 9th island French toast, our server noticed it was missing the toasted coconut and coconut syrup and promptly brought it over. Honestly, it was delicious. When ordering she asked if I wanted fruit added to it. I declined but it came with a bit of fruit anyways. Exactly 6 blueberries, 3 small chunks of melon and 1/3 slice of a strawberry. The fruit was awkward and most of the blueberries were not in the best shape.   My husband ordered the omelette, as described above. Though lacking in flavor, I really like the idea of the thin layer of hash browns which ensures you get a nice crunch all around.    The restaurant itself had basic decor. Not bad, not intriguing. It was hot but without tinting their windows I don't think there's much they can do about that since the sun happens to rise on that side.   Overall, the cost did not justify the experience. I think with some work they could do well. The menu needs a revamp. It's hard to navigate. It's just a list of food items with nothing that really draws the eye.

photos.caption: Photo of Dirty Fork - Las Vegas, NV, United States

3VC6RJwZ6_koAN4-2Bj4nQ.text: Came here for breakfast despite the off-putting name because the reviews were pretty good. There was no AC and there were flies dive bombing us the whole time.   The service was good, but when our food came, I was not impressed. I ordered the Paris Panini, and the sandwich came out with thick, fluffy bread that wasnt pressed at all... and the eggs were done scrambled... this wasn't specified on the menu and it was my fault for assuming a French style panini would come with eggs another way. It had no flavor. It was $11... I could have made a better sandwich at home for pennies compared to that.    We also got the Loco Moco... the meat seemed to have been a frozen patty... for angus beef, fresh would be better... and the rice was kind of crunchy.   Again, the service was good, but we definitely won't be back.

iE_QArPfIE2A0KMzm4S-zQ.text: Delicious Food! Customer service was amazing. I got the buttermilk chicken sliders. My husband got the Loco Moco and really enjoyed it. Loved how calm it was.

There were only two of us in the restaurant which made it a nice Sunday morning for my son & I. We got the Eggs Benedict, kid's breakfast, & two fresh squeezed orange juices. This is a casual place, but a bit on the pricier side. Food was delicious and customer service was on point. They also have pastries like croissants and muffins. I'll be back to try the lunch.

F4ypq0nbjYaaZjaMybtriQ.text: LOVE THIS PLACE! Although, I have never actually been inside. I order my breakfast from them about once a week. The food is always on-time, hot, and the woman who delivers to me(whom I need to learn her name) is super sweet and kind!  I have had a few different things from them and they never disappoint. Great coffee, btw. They keep outdoing themselves. This is my go to breakfast spot and it should be yours, too.

k03LB3gUl4A9mhHBpGHKow.text: On 04/27/19 The family brother had been wanting to dine here since we arrived in Las Vegas as the pineapple fried rice dish caught his attention.   After checking out from the hotel we decided to head on over to the Dirty Fork which was about a 20 minute drive from the Strip. We arrived and was instantly seated.  I have to say the decor was so cute and trendy and I was curious of how this restaurant received its name. But mostly hoping that the forks were actually clean. Anywho, they had so many delicious looking items in their dessert case that were calling my eye but I ended up just get a Chicken Pesto Panini. If you know me I am not a huge Panini person and decided to try something different which was a flop.  I honestly did not enjoy my Panini at all. It was so dry and burnt. It was so hard to chew. But I ate it as I was hungry. The staff appeared to be in training as they did not appear to know what they were doing. One staff member broke a glass behind me and glass went everywhere.  The service was SO slow and they kept messing up on everything. They got my brothers order wrong twice. They forgot a second order of his Sahemi.  Other patrons dining in were experiencing the same problems as well. It may have been just an off service day but not a good impression after dining at Hells Kitchen the evening before.  Mostly everyone in the group enjoyed their meal but I was not happy about the SLOW service, blah food and messed up orders.  Maybe another day is better but the Sunday that we went they were having serious problems. I'm all about second chances but it is definitely hard to consider this restaurant due to my experience.

43tnQ9_nEdfPvfGbulaewg.text: After reading Yelp reviews for restaurants in the area, Dirty Fork was one that really stood out! The fun decor and delicious food pics enticed us mostly.  Upon entering the restaurant, we were greeted and seated. Our drink orders were taken immediately. The inside was clean and inviting. They even have a dessert case filled with a variety of pastries (scones, Macarons, crossaints, danish, cookies, cannoli, and bread pudding)   We ended up ordering the Hilo Style Loco Moco, Dirty Fork Breakfast Special, and a side of bacon and fruit bowl. Everything was absolutely delicious! I can't complain about anything. It was a lot of food for two people, but it was so good, we ate every morsel and ended up skipping lunch!   The staff was friendly and the food came out fast! This restaurant is located in a strip mall so there's plenty of parking available. Would highly recommend!

eeRK58LDwJonCAV-PLDK0g.text: The food was fantastic!  The service left us wanting some improvement, but I'm still giving them five stars for the food and efforts!  We were headed back into town after running some trails out at Aramgosa, and decided to stop for brunch.   The restaurant wasn't busy late morning on a Saturday, with no wait, so we were pleasantly surprised.  I doubt we are able to get in that easy again in the future once people start talking about this place!  First race, the coffee!  It was some Italian brand and it was amazing.  Rich and smooth, served at the perfect temperature.  We tried a few of the breakfast items: the What the Fork omelette, Sunrise Sammy and Parisian Panini.  Everything was delicious, tasty and fresh.  Everything was cooked per our requests.  The service was lacking.  It was slow and forgetful, especially with the restaurant not being at all busy.  Hopefully, this is just a learning curve with new staff.  Parking was easy, free, plentiful and convenient right in front of the restaurant 's storefront.  I will most definitely be returning again for brunch to the Dirty Fork!

PyggF_DJukzQrmORtcbFBA.text: Brunch in Las Vegas...  Craig Y. suggested that we meet here... I couldn't think of anything at the time.  My friends from Los Angeles, Arizona, and Honolulu were all in Las Vegas at the same time.  It was a great opportunity for a get together - some people were meeting in real life for the first time!  I was too excited to eat.  I ordered anyway...  "What The Fork" Omelet jumped out at me: Bell peppers, mushrooms, sweet onions, Swiss cheese, with avocado and a side of Toast...yum!  I usually like breakfast and an omelette is something that can't really be messed up, right?  Anyway, the place was pleasantly decorated; the parking was free; the service was satisfactory; and the restroom was convenient!    What more could we want?    A dirty fork?  We all got our own after we ate!

LwGn7KE1wrBYKLEGGHqgOg.text: Whew! At least the forks weren't dirty!  When my flight landed at about midnight several hours earlier, all I wanted to do was take a nice shower and hit the sheets. So by the time 1pm rolled around and I was about to have breakfast food for lunch, I was starved and was ready to attack some good eats.  Before we all got to Vegas, the suggestion was made to hit this place up. I wasn't all that impressed by what I saw on Yelp, but hey, why not try anyway? Right?! Well, I'll tell ya why not. My food sucked!  So these guys have quite a bit of things on the menu here, and after looking it over for awhile, I decided on getting the Fatty Burrito. For whatever reason, my food took the longest to come out. And I don't even know why because it was a Fatty Burrito that was fat with mostly eggs. After the first couple of bites, there was hardly any bacon, cheese, or guacamole in it. And the sucker was nasty tasting too. It was hella salty. A salty egg burrito is what I had. Lol.  Thank goodness I was in the company of friends who more than made up for the crappy burrito I got. And although our server was friendly and attentive, it ain't enough to bring me back. Nuff said!

szNGqPCSXkXL4sEZXZKT7Q.text: **I ordered through the DoorDash app. My order was received and sent out fast, which is a Big PLUS!   So i'm at this car dealership waiting forever. I'm bored, hungry and everyone over here is keeping to themselves...it's not like these people sitting at the customer lounge wanted to talk and make friends...   I pulled out my phone and decided to get food delivered. I've never been to this place before, but have heard a lot about it.  I ordered the Lox Bagel, which came with a side of spring salad. I wish there was an option for drinks because I needed some coffee bad! (The Starbucks coffee machine wasn't working at this dealership.) Everything in the lox bagel was perfect. I enjoyed it. I'm pretty sure I will come here in person soon and check out the other items. Kinda want to try the 9th Island French Toast next time.

xi7aPt677ohcL8n9sq3hiQ.text: My fork wasn't dirty when we were seated. False advertisement! Fake news!  I jest, of course. Call me crazy but I'm glad they have clean forks here. ;P  Any time I see eggs benny on a menu, I gotta have it! It fulfills my horror movie fantasies when I stab into a gently poached egg and all their bodily-yolky-fluid comes cascading out like a waterfall of yellowish-orange goo! Are you readers hungry yet? Hah!   So I ordered the Eggs-quisite Benedict. The accompanying salad was fresh and the vinaigrette was flavorful. The eggs itself were poached nicely, the yolk popping and bleeding profusely at the softest prick of a knife, but sadly my hollandaise was broken. A broken hollandaise is a sin [see the attached picture for the curdled mess]! I was heartbroken but I was with a fun bunch so I didn't bother telling the waitstaff about it.  The staff was friendly and the place was clean. I had fun with my Yelp homies from Honolulu, Orange County, and Torrance! It was a our own little Yelper Party!

RTZZOiJ0E2Ucx1B_bSyMtw.text: It was pretty good. Nothing that I would rave about. Small little dine in area. The floors were extremely sticky. Quick & friendly service. The food presentation was very pretty. Taste-wise it wasn't impressive, but you'd eat it. Interesting combinations. The cost was surprisingly affordable.

XmtY3zarHjorKo5DrePcAA.text: I'd put this as an "okay" experience. I had been eyeing their 9th Island French Toast on Instagram for quite some time, so when I finally had a day off, I was excited to finally try it. The restaurant itself is cute, homey and bright. We were seated right away, but the tables for 2 are super tiny! They ended up having to move us to a bigger table because the table wouldn't hold all of our food and drinks.  The coffee was delicious, and the server allowed me to use my Yelp check in for coffee instead of soda, which I appreciated. We wanted the 9th Island French Toast, as I mentioned, but wanted to make it a combo with eggs and meat. The server pointed us to a French toast combo platter, so we got that. It came with chicken and eggs, which I thought was an interesting combo. I asked the server if the chicken came as pieces, because I wanted to specify dark meat. She said yes, and moved along with our order.   Imagine our surprise when the French toast was just regular French toast with sliced strawberries on it, and the chicken was "pieces of breaded chicken"- basically like chopped up chicken nuggets!! Uh, definitely not what we expected.  The French toast was fine, but there wasn't anything special about it. It didn't come with butter on it, and they only had packets of margarine. The chicken actually didn't taste badly, it just was unexpected! The eggs were very good though.  Our total with the coffee and two platters was $31.   Nothing to write home about, but I wasn't upset at the experience. The hunt for great breakfast spots continues!

mAuT22AgP6Y9zk8_x0qpDQ.text: This is an updated review from my initial one. I'll be honest I had no desire to go but as I was with an entire group of people I put my ego aside & went. Very excited you finally taste the food (which was the reason why I wanted to go in the first place).   To be honest service was a little better. Our server was very nice & friendly but overall staff doesn't seem to be engaging.   Food came out & looked amazing; not just mine. My food came out (picture attached) & it was tasty but just not incredible as I had hoped it to be. Price point was not bad either.   _____________  Let's paint a picture...just under 30minutes to spare before one of only like 2 breakfast places in the area are getting ready to close. I saw a picture of the pancakes and read a review about how great the food was. I was so excited. As I walked into the restaurant at 3:08pm, I was barely greeted with one of the servers kinda of under her breath saying they were closed. The restaurant advertised online and on the front door to close at 3:30pm with 2 tables still dining but the CLOSED sign flipped on the door. The server asked the cook if he wanted to turn on the grill (which means they must have shut down early and cleaned it to not want to turn it back on; someone was ready to get out of work early today)   Fortunately, with all that is available in the area, I will never return to this place just on the laissez-fair attitude they have. How over-the-top could this place be if the ethic of the place is to shut down whenever they feel like it.   Good luck.   For those that read this, just a friendly reminder that just around the corner Mimosas Gourmet is scheduled to open until 4pm. Friendly & professional service. Check my next review for the upcoming food

JhdVQO6HMp8rJMIWkEaZEA.text: The food was delicious and the service was great. Would def recommend. Everyone was very courteous and attentive. My friend and I were catching up so we were there for quite awhile and they were very accommodating.

2qsBMmzScrnx1qnt0HdqZw.text: I wasn't expecting a side salad with my Eggs Benedict but it was REALLY good. The Eggs Benedict was delicious and my wife had the Dirty Fork special and the chicken and that was good. Overall one of the breakfast places we've been to in Vegas so far.

j6B-826UecqUDNT_4AU9GQ.text: Food was good, but what would've made it better is the service. Irma never checked how the food was. After food delivery she was busy training a guy and teaching him how to make cappuccinos. I needed a touch more syrup on my French toast. Secondly on the picture on yelp there was more yogurt looking substance on the French toast than 2 squirts literally. And it states on the menu that you can add fruit well DONT! It already comes with fruit and I didn't want any. The Sunrise Sammy is good but croissant is way too toasted that the ends are so hard I left it behind. Like the croissant was toasted over and over. Honestly, server didn't deserve tip; she bought water with no ice which I never once stated I DIDNT want ice, she took order and delivered. Than I went up to register asking to pay. That was NOT service!

1DwdF71xoqQeI6l0D-TPuA.text: Wonderful restaurant! I wanted to try something new and I saw this place a few days ago when I was driving by and then noticed they were offering a Groupon. My friend who's recently moved to Vegas found an apartment and I said we should celebrate so I took him to Brunch after he had signed his lease. I had the Dirty Fork Lunch Special which was delicious and came with fresh fruit. I actually ate the whole thing which is a rarity for me I'm usually one of those people with eyes too big for ones stomach who ends up eating several bites and takes the rest home. The owner (James? I'm apologize if you're reading this I'm horrible with remembering names) was what made my experience a 5 star one. He was friendly and sociable he must've chatted with me and my friend for 10 or so minutes and I really dig that about a place when the owner makes time for you to engage in friendly conversation. I will definitely be a returning customer. Thanks again!

gO8MGthyiPtW0mnwoWmBUw.text: Awaome breafast and lunch menu with an island infusion. Food is amazing fresh from scratch, and the service is spot on. Try the bread pudding with the island sauce you'll thank me later.

4bQkev0XphPmM3bVb5V5Wg.text: Beautiful waitress, incredible food, very aesthetically pleasing atmosphere. All the food was beautifully plated and the owner even dropped by to say hello. So thrilled to live up the street and  definitely inviting the girls for afternoon tea here!

KB2GdFSDC16cOXSgyAyakw.text: went here yesterday........ food was great had the french toast and  fried chicken with strawberry's was so yummy great twist on chicken and waffles. Waitress we friendly and service was perfect.

cPtYW7o3mNIsVMbpgOts3Q.text: Went here while on vacation, great service and a great brunch! The Breakfast Burrito was fresh and delicious! Definitely recommend to both locals and those visiting!

txAeHh5fzoyMy9dQCvTn0w.text: Great service, great food and 80% organic. Really a fantastic breakfast/lunch spot. Being a bit of a "coffee snob" the coffee here was pretty good as well. A one stop shop for breakfast.

Ng90CJ-_AV3-37fTaPKzVg.text: very GOOD! I'm not one to rave about a restaurant. But the Dirty Fork deserves the accolades  of a 5 star experience. Fresh, cooked or prepared to perfection. Large portions. First visit and will definitely return. Happened upon The Dirty Fork when we stopped there to eat at a previous restaurant that used to reside at the same location and had moved. Decided to give The Dirty Fork a try and so glad we did. While you may think upon initially looking at the menu that the prices are a bit high, fear not, as you'll get more than your monies worth in quantity and excellent quality. As the four of us shared our food from our plates, when have you ever done that at breakfast, we noticed other diners eating there at the same time we were sharing their food with each other too. :-)  currently there's a Groupon, so get it while you can.

KDPePb9fNtRkqzbFdO4YcQ.text: Yummy yummy such a good place and the owner was so sweet! Laughed a lot!!!  Fresh food which is always a plus!

aTHfoHcDoTn5N1DI_KXlwQ.text: Let me start by saying I can't believe anyone would leave a negative review for this restaurant. I'm so glad I didn't let that stop me from coming here. The staff was attentive and friendly without being over bearing. Our server KJ was very helpful and pleasant. The restaurant itself is decorated simply and beautifully. The menu, which is a French Hawaiian mix,  is creative and fun. I went with two other people for breakfast and we were all very pleased with our choices. I can't wait to go back for the afternoon tea, what an awesome concept. Definitely give this restaurant a try!

wOgS_5Z_Qql0L4WNEHPY5g.text: Pancakes are great especially with the Guava Syrup. My server ( Stephanie ) was awesome. She was prompt, friendly, and knowledgeable.  VERY PROFESSIONAL.  Would definitely come back.

tcajnX16Q5JgKkXu_1q4gg.text: Nicely done, Vegas has been missing a place like this! Great addition to the breakfast scene. Healthy, organic options and a nice array of menu options will bring me back to this neighborhood spot. Service is also spot on.

myej1dE8UXzuKK6oowPjFA.text: This place is new to Vegas and I was anxious to try it while my sister was in town. The location is convenient, and sitting on the patio gets you a decent view of the grassy park across the street - PLUS, it's dog friendly on the patio. The owner even brought my pup a little dog biscuit, and the server made sure he had plenty of water. My sister and I split the Vegas Avocado Toast and the greek yogurt bowl (forgetting the name now). The dishes themselves were beautifully presented and cooked perfectly. They have enough healthy choices that you don't feel gross after you're done inhaling everything! The service was great, quick, and we had plenty of coffee refills. We enjoyed taking our time over our meal, and the owner came out to talk with us a few times. He mentioned they plan on gating in the patio, which will make dog owners feel more secure and help give the place some curb appeal. Will definitely be back!

4wf5_EaToCD6P8nmN7y8zA.text: Awesome food... fresh and wonderful quiche with great service and nice ambiance.  Very clean and relaxing.  The almond croissant was delicious.  Try it.... you'll like it!

BMvdidZRD9-zgu6aySz0PQ.text: Just had brunch here with my friend and daughter.  Food is AMAZING!!  Everything is SO fresh and So healthy!!  Don't let the name fool you, it's quite elegant.  Its a new and refreshing change in menu items.  A lot of organics here, too.  Fatih is the Chef and he takes great pride in his place.  I highly recommend this place and will be back!!

XI5mAXZhKPrKGIM4M0Fkig.text: Excellent food and great service. Very clean. Loved the choice of turkey bacon to accompany my eggs. Most places do not offer that. Had the pleasure of meeting the owners too. Wonderful hospitable couple. Thanks. Will be back soon.

Mynp12P9dn8L15pF6QBGQg.text: Food was sooo  yummy!! Service was amazing & the owner such a friendly guy!! The french toast with fresh fruits to die for!

l_f_FaX97mK07di6jtnC2g.text: I first found Dirty Fork on Instagram with their fabulous photos. Once I saw they are walking distance in my own neighborhood I knew they were a definite future dining experience. I'm happy to say we weren't disappointed! I got the Ms. Lorraine and my son got the Sunrise Sammy. Both were delicious! The service was fantastic, the restaurant was clean and has a pleasant atmosphere. We'll be back again.

H7991Pru_QvA-Y3GIemh5Q.text: Delicious food, great service and very affordable. I loved the "Vegas poached eggs" dish.

SmS3uC3P2am61Lx1LBgM8w.text: New place is awesome with organic food high quality healthy and tasty! Great makeover inside!!

6pUVt0N9JgZUDcjOLSCjbw.text: Food was good enough and looked pretty once it finally came out... it just took forrrrrrrever to come out (and they weren't even that busy).

Awl_6y6TtXB4zKwWCZf3dA.text: The menu selection is fantastic!the presentation of the food is excellent as well.i totally recommend this establishment!perfect for breakfast &brunch.

Zps18S7B5Ha9vl0LgOppzw.text: First of all, the young gal who waited on us was very nice and attentive.   True, it was a Saturday morning and there was only one other table besides us, but her service was nothing less than stellar.  Unfortunately, the food was forgettable and pricey.  Lots of breakfast places around to pick from...sadly, I'll be picking one other than the Dirty Fork.

aYz0rMemqpjxTfZJ9rnJ7A.text: Delicious food. We were greeted as we walked in and service was fast and friendly. The 9th island French toast is delicious. The guava cream cheese they put on it left me wanting more!

IPXdb93srPFMv6HfBQqh9w.text: Absolutely one of the best eateries I have been blessed to visit. I enjoyed the ambient, quality, and the service. Please visit often.

PhAoghsA-1e0_sJ_egYyvg.text: Not worth an almost 50 dollar bill for two people here. Came in the restaurant with a few occupancy yet it took awhile to get our food which consisted of a panini/salad and the dirty fork special. Ordered the 5 dollar fresh squeezed oj, it was the only thing that actually tasted good. Definitely will not order again because it came in such a tiny glass. Left unimpressed and wishing I ate somewhere else.....

zj3FZwMakER9WjVMV3NCBw.text: Wow! 5 stars, eh? Not quite. First, we ordered two dishes. Blueberry Pancakes and the house special (french toast with eggs and fried chicken on top). Five minutes after we ordered the server notified us that they were out of blueberries. That isn't what killed it for me. Upon receiving the "special," I immediately wondered where the chicken was. Oh, there it is. It was 2 oz of finely diced frozen, processed chicken strips. Let me remind you that this dish costs $13. The owner/chef came to our table twice to make sure everything was ok. The second time I attempted to explain to him that I was disappointed they had used frozen, processed chicken. He explained that they couldn't use fresh chicken because it wouldn't be crispy. Wow!! Well, Sir, I invite you to go to any place in Vegas and try something called CHICKEN AND WAFFLES!! You will certainly be served a hand breaded piece of actual chicken. One more place crossed off the list... shame shame

VyY9t4OAwu_6du3vdEeptA.text: *not vegetarian/vegan friendly**rude/unhelpful staff* I was really excited to try this place, a nice breakfast/brunch place near my home that's not an egg works branch but I was greatly disappointed in the service (he was a young man in his early 20s with blonde hair and of short stature). My mom and I came in for breakfast around 9am and the place had about 2 tables that were filled(expected because it is still quite new). The waiter brought us our menus and I realized there weren't any vegetarian or vegan options (I'm a vegetarian) so I opted to ask the waiter what my choices were and he told me "a salad" and that tone in his voice was so rude and insincere. In the end (without his help) I opted for a fruit bowl and hash browns. Now, when my hash browns came out they came out black (literally, both sides were black and burnt) and when I brought this to the waiters attention he played off the burnt hash brown saying "hash browns are like this" (????? At this point it's clear he obviously eats from the dumpster) so I asked if I could have it browned instead & the second time they came perfect. NOW, this waiter at this point knows I'm a vegetarian but he didn't think to tell me that the hash browns were cooked with butter... I took a bite of the hash browns and ~butter explosion~. The owner did come to check up on us once and he seems like he genuinely wants this place to flourish and the food is decent BUT TRAIN YOUR WAITSTAFF THEY ARE THE KEY TO A SUCCESSFUL RESTAURANT!!!!!

2AbQ7KGa_7XZ5wMt6ANl2g.text: First time eating here I stumbled across this place on Instagram and thought I'd give it a try on 8/11/18 my first take on the establishment was it was beautiful, nice and clean and there were a good amount of people inside not too busy so it had to be a good establishment. The staff was at first friendly and had greeted me and my partner when we walked through the doors and immediately seated us.  Being from the islands that was the True ALOHA spirit.   FIRST, We were given the menus and  of course as any typical establishment asks what we would like to drink- we asked for water. Our waitress walked out with a   Cylinder of water and two small cups she had filled them up and walked away. When I looked up I noticed not only was my water dirty(like dirt floating in the cylinder) but my cup also had lipstick on it (mind you I was not wearing any) When our waitress had came back to take our order I had asked her if she could take the water back and if we could order bottled water instead.(At this point she had an attitude because she had to get us bottled water).  SECOND, when our food came out and of course plated beautifully I had the What the Fork Omelette & my Partner had the 9th Island French Toast.. We had requested that the coolwhip and guava cream cheese be placed on the side they had placed them in these small little stainless steel condiment cups those cups were DIRTY too and had gunk and left over food  underneath the rim of the container.  At this point I was disgusted and was ready to request for the check.   I had mentioned the second incident to our waitress yet again and requested for our check she then asked us if we would like to go plates and I looked at her in disbelief and asked her as to why she would ask us that after we mentioned everything that has taken place since we came thru the doors and she has not once acknowledged anything and acted completely oblivious to everything we mentioned.. at least a " sorry mam, let me take care of that for you" she then walked away  NEVER brought us our CHECK and stayed behind the counter talking to another person.  At this point I was irritated, I had  walked up to the counter there was a male waitress at the register printing out checks for tables. I asked him for my check he looked at me with a blank stare for a good 2-3 minutes and then goes "oh I'm not your waiter you got to ask her" and taps my waitress on the shoulder she turns her head slightly  looks at me  and goes right back to talking to thee other person I continue to wait for another good 2-3 minutes before I raise my voice and Say EXCUSE ME I am ready to PAY and get the hell out of here. She takes my payment with attitude and notices when I do not give a TIP gives even more of an attitude.    Needless to say this will be my FIRST and LAST time coming here.. your employees are a HUGE representation of your company and if that is who you choose to represent your company I must say you are in trouble. I completely understand we have good days and bad days but this was just ridiculous. And then to EXPECT a TIP? A tip should never be EXPECTED especially if you have a bad attitude and horrible service!

dEt8C7K_bzOVXWwF3c7i1w.text: Excellent breakfast spot! The service was excellent (so friendly and happy to help, made us feel like family). They were open for breakfast on Thanksgiving, which we out-of-towners really appreciated. The 9th island French toast was some of the best French toast I've ever had (and I order French toast at every breakfast spot I go to). It was perfectly cooked (no dry spots in the center yet still tall and fluffy) and the guava cream cheese spread was the perfect touch, just enough to give it a unique, intoxicating flavor but not overly cream cheesy or sweet or gimmicky. Just absolute perfection. The coffee was fantastic too, as were the croissants. Really excellent place all around with a great laid back, welcoming vibe.

nqLxU3E1dfiD8Jmc3yUJbA.text: The service here is very unorganized and does not seem to know what they are doing. While waiting we noticed a couple of times they had to move already seated customers to another table, which made them upset. There was also a wet rag on the floor that was dropped from the busser that was running across the restaurant from the table he just seated. The lady that was seated had to kick the dirty rag to the side. Gross. We sat down and wasn't given any menus to look at. Made our food choices from looking at photos on yelp. Waitress came 10 minutes after to take our order. Another 20 minutes no water or coffee was served to our table. My daughter was thirsty, so I had to get up and walk to the front of restaurant where 3 different servers were standing there. One server told our server to bring us water and coffee. She came by apologized saying she's "running around like a chicken." She came back with 2 complimentary macaroons. Waited a while again and my husband had to ask for utensils and napkins. My food and my daughters French toast came out after waiting about 35 minutes. My husbands loco moco, however, came out 15 minutes after ours. His food finally came out was told that they messed up his order not having the fried rice on it. The patty had no seasoning in it. It just tasted like meat. So we ate our "so-so" meal and waited for the waitress to pick up our check. They were busy dealing with another upset customer at the moment. I ended up having to walk up to the register to pay for my meal and they gave us 10% off.

dUr5ZtDfzEZde8QT6T1s-A.text: We came here today because we saw a deal on Groupon. When we got to Dirty Fork we were immediately sat and a couple moments later given water. After looking at the menu the server comes by and ask if we are ready to order I told her yes we're ready and she walks away to another table. hHNCoz2UqNKydnQQkuQx4Q.text: Ah I seriously don't like to leave bad reviews, and have only ever left one. This one just needs to be said. Came here after reading a great review and was really excited. Looks mostly cute and modern minus the very tacky ornaments and black curled ribbon hanging everywhere. Those IKEA lights would look a million times better if they didn't have all those extra frills suffocating them. I wanted to cut them down so bad! Please adjust this and let your restaurant be a restaurant and not a quinceanera who's favorite color is teal. Okay no that's not most important, the food clearly is.  We glanced over the menu and saw some awesome looking things. Lady at the table next to me had this great looking frittata style dish and I had to get that. But first I saw "Scone with clotted cream and jam." I bounced at the idea of that, since I love European baked goods and the fact it came with clotted cream was epic! Well my waitress suggests to NOT heat the scone because the cream get gross on top. On top? Cream is not on the side as traditionally served I asked? No she said. Okay so I took her suggestion. Scone comes, with no clotted cream and jam, it's triangular and flat, and has a hard glaze over it. Ummmm wtf? This is zero like any scones with clotted cream and jam. So I try it and my fork almost broke off. Hard as a rock. Literally. I could throw this against the wall. I tell the waitress how this has no cream or jam and is hard as a rock and I want to trade out. She's confused. Says she can bring me cream cheese and jam. What?! That's NOT clotted cream. So now my dreams of a warm scone and clotted cream, which if you're wondering at this point what that is, we'll it's divine. Like a smooth, spreadable slightly sweetened marriage of whipped cream and butter. Usually served cold next to a warm scone. So now you can see why I'm so bummed. I ask for a chocolate croissant because now I'm really wanting to feed my pastry hankering and if a restaurant is going to have a display case of great pastries, well I'm trying. She brings out and then, only then, offers to warm it. Uhh ya, who doesn't want a warm pastry? It returns warm and I try to stick my fork in and yet again, stale, hard, gross. WHYYYYYY?????? You are offering such great pastries on your menu but they've been refrigerated and hard as rocks?! Then they are served nothing as described on the menu? Come on. Okay that was just the appetizer which at this point I've eaten neither. My dish comes out and is served with a small side salad which I like and can identify the yummy raspberry dressing from a local grocery store. Definitely not homemade. So that's three things I've eaten now that are clearly not freshly made at this restaurant. So what is made there? I go to eat my quiche/ frittata dish and hmmm, damn....no luck here. The egg is just straight up mush. Like full of liquid and I'm worried it's not even edible. I'm so hungry though and the favors are good, but the texture is just soooooo gross. Like not fully cooked. I completely struck out and will never return. Such a bummer because it seemed so cute and had a chic menu. They really gotta hit the drawing boards again before serving another dish.

G79lA5YXy6CAt1bkwKWUwg.text: Originally I came to eat at norms egg cafe Little did I know, norms wasn't there. Instead I found the dirty fork, at first glance it looked super fancy inside, but really they just cleaned up well and chose an exquisite color scheme, along with their decorative lights, and their succulents chilling in a vase on each table. I ask for a menu before I sit down, the menu had much to offer, I was honestly quite surprised, I was expecting to see overpriced classic breakfast dishes, like $15 for your typical pancakes sausage eggs and bacon this was not the case here. The menu consisted of what one would say "exotic" dishes. Lox on toast, Hawaiian bread toast with coconut syrup and guava or passion fruit cream cheese! They had this dish called the madame which is what I got, it was a surplus amount of ham and cheese, a spread of some mustard, and more Swiss cheese oozed on top of the sandwich and then finished with an Egg over easy as the cherry on top! The taste was absolutely indescribable, my partner had ordered the jade toast with the guava cream cheese, and I almost couldn't tell if this was breakfast or dessert for breakfast executed with perfection. The presentation, really made it difficult to want to desecrate such a beautiful piece of work. The best part was that it's all organic food, I'm sick of all these lard factories we call breakfast diners. If there's any place you want to treat someone to for breakfast, or just eat right, it's here.

9mLuLlqm-rVRStMnxPwDFw.text: We were the only customers and services was slow. The menu options for breakfast is limited. Not what I was expecting.

Specifically asked for no bell peppers since they make me sick and I open my omelet and immediately bell peppers come out. The servers' response "well I put no bell peppers, sorry". Would have been manageable if the omelet had been good but it clearly wasn't mixed well since some parts had too much flavor and other parts were extremely bland. No in between. Tried to enjoy the toast since my omelet wasn't good but my first bite, I cut my gum on the rock-hard crust. Fabulous. I'll deal with sub par food or bad service but both? No thanks.

S3apB3rZuZNMsmM1hb9Q1A.text: Horrible experience . I messaged the owner prior to writing this review and they didn't even bother to apologize for the bad experience at their restaurant. So here I am spilling the truth about this place based on my own experience. I bought a groupon for this place and was excited to try a new hip neighborhood eatery so I came there with my family one morning. We stood up at the door waiting for a waiter or a host but after waiting a good 7 minutes, we tried to get one of the waiter to help us but they were too busy running around serving others. Tables were dirty, this place is understaffed. We then decided to take a long table by the door but a mean looking lady at the cashier just yelled at us and said "give us a moment". A moment? We've been standing infront of her for now about 15 minutes and that's the respond we'll get? And still no waiter or waitress attending us. The excitement went out the window when we waited for so long for service so we got up and we all left to go to another breakfast joint.   Like I said I messaged this place on Instagram messaging hoping to be able to help improve their service but I was ignored. ( made me feel like I was on the wrong for giving my concern) No reply, no apology, no thank you for letting us know either.  If I can do a zero star that's well deserved for this place!

Ww_ZCI84frJ_cMONqi6CWg.text: NO "Aloha Spirit" in this establishment whatsoever.... I will never return!  1) Walking in, no one greeted us. Not even a smile nothing, it took awhile for someone to notice, it was not until we were about to walk out they acknowledged us. Service sucks! Especially Fatih, the misogynistic fool aka manager.  2) The chicken panini's bread tasted stale & literally had only 3 small strips of chicken. 3) Hawaiian French toast was sad. The "guava cream cheese" literally was a teaspoon of flavorless junk. Bread tasted like it was re-microwaved & the fruit tasted overripe, overall totally dissatisfied with the food. .... totally dissatisfied, with absolutely everything the food & service, took one bite & we were done and decided to pack the food To Go .  .... we returned from our car to find out they did not give us the coconut syrup rather they gave us regular syrup.. so we requested for some coconut syrup.. here's where it becomes good. This arrogant, chunky, misogynistic fool starts yelling at us, saying that he's the manager/cook FATIH & that he did in fact place coconut syrup in our order. There was another worker in the back that told him that he in fact put maple & basically told him to shut up. At this point, we were heated, he literally started YELLING at us basically saying he's right & we are wrong. Now, we are just disgruntled & kindly asked for a refund, & returned the food. Now this misogynistic fool, FATIH starts yelling & saying NO REFUND (like an angry bulldog) & that only the owner can approve it. After arguing, his pettiness, on a business card, writes a note with the amount of the toast for "store credit". Now, I ask him for a # to call the owner... he gives me the same # on his card. Turns out the customer outside told us that him & his wife owns the place & and that customer ended up leaving as well.   As someone who's entire family is from Hawaii, this has place NO aloha spirit whatsoever. Worst customer service EVER.

ibmCUoEXYnFwzgLvh-mFcA.text: Everything is fresh, delicious, and beautifully presented. I had the Fatty Burrito and the tiramisu (one of the best tiramisu you'll EVER have). MALmYvhSORHVPBvqKqYsiw.text: Awesome Turkish/Hawaiian fusion place. We had Breakfast Sammie (croissant with bacon and egg) and Special Breakfast (Hawaiian French toast with scrambled egg in a hole and fried chicken topped with syrup). Both were excellent and felt light even though the description doesn't necessarily suggest that. The latte was perfect - medium roast well ground coffee without much bitterness and perfectly frothed milk on top with lightly sweet tasting foam. Dessert... This was the best part of the morning. Tiramisu is easy top 3 I ever had. Firm bottom cake not too coffee and not too wet. Topped with a very firm cream/custard and cocoa powder, all made in house. Canoli - not overly sweet with firm outer shell and soft and delicious cream filling with chocolate bits. Macaroons were dense outer shell and soft filling, chocolate and strawberry (one of each).  Head chef Fathi (SP?) Is Turkish, a very cool guy and very personable. His wife is Hawaiian hence the fusion. He promised to have a more fully featured Turkish menu for dinner over the coming weeks.   We will definitely be back for more!

PwVP5i-gwkqaypxO-a-8vg.text: Update: I came to pickup my cash for the incorrect credit charge and even though the owner said the money would be there for me in an envelope, I was NOT shocked to discover that he did not leave the money for me, I expected this to be an annoying process based on my previous dealings with this guy. When I arrived I let the server know that the owner was leaving money for me, she asked if I was Michael and I said yes (side note, this woman is super unpleasant). She told me to give her a minute while she takes care of a table and that was fine. After a few minutes she told me that the owner told her to call him when I showed up. So, I waited about 10 more minutes while she talked to the owner on the phone and wrote out a note. She came over and handed me the note and money and asked me to sign, I did and left. This dude has poor judgement through and through. How about pulling the cash and leaving it in an envelope like you said you were going to do instead of pawning it off on an hourly employee? Why would you make her do the work when YOU said you would would do it? This guy doesn't deserve to have employees, he's not cool.

wX0nw1AuHBfkxpW7IjJwgw.text: Filthy Fork.  I don't want to, and I don't like to give poor reviews to establishments. But at the same time, consumers, customers, and people must be warned and aware of the experiences we have when we spend our hard earned money.  We were Seated and greeted promptly with no problem. But then the server proceeded with bare hands to pick up trash off the floor, along with some dirty dishes off a table all wearing no gloves. I watched the server then go grab drinks for a table, deliver the drinks to the table in front of us, and then come back to our table and ask us what we wanted to drink. I was a little grossed out quickly from the picking up of items on the floor.  Scrambled eggs, chicken and waffles, that's what we ordered, simple. The chicken and waffles had a long large gross black hair on the plate, but not touching the food. It was absolutely disgusting, but I wanted to be mature, showed the hair to my girlfriend, and attempted to eat the meal because it wasn't touching any food, it was on the edge of my dish. How the cook and the waitress didn't see it is beyond me. The chicken was fatty, over cooked, and mostly fat and breading. The waffles were tasteless, and I was given no syrup, and there wasn't any of the table nor any offered to me. The dish came with ranch dressing that was watery and useless.  My girlfriend was upset because she was mad I didn't return the dish with the hair for starters. But to make matters worse her eggs were over cooked and had that burnt brown bottom all over her eggs. Pathetic. Either the cook had the burners too high, the pan too hot, the oil too hot, forgot about the eggs cooking, or just flat out didn't look or care while he cooked one side of the eggs.  The worst part about this entire experience was the waitress had about 4-5 tables as we paid the check and left. Someone who either owned the restaurant or managed the restaurant was sitting his fat ass down in the corner from the time we arrived to the time we left. He never moved a muscle to help the waitress with anything, as if he was above that or it wasn't his job as the owner or manager. How this place has a positive rating is beyond me. Perhaps they just had a horrible horrible hour of cooking, service, & laziness? But we won't ever return nor recommend.

npkmrWtCbrzlPX_Wh7SpRQ.text: I honestly hate writing negative reviews.  I came here when they first opened with my boyfriend & got the Vegas style toast which was good (obviously multigrain toast, avocado, smoked salmon how could you go wrong?). The only thing I didn't care for was the yogurt on the bottom on the plate but NBD  We then went a second time & I decided to get the Dirty Fork Lunch Special without pico de gallo and replaced the bread to multigrain.  Absolutely loved it.     3rd time I went was with a girlfriend & I got the same Dirty Fork Lunch Special with my alterations.  The 4th and last time I went.  I had my boyfriend order since he arrived before me and I told him the vegas toast with no pico de gallo and multigrain toast.  But I meant the Dirty Fork Lunch Special & mixed it up.  So I received the Vegas style toast no pico de gallo (it doesn't originally have pico)  I'm aware that the order wasn't correct (honest mistake) but I do feel like the waitress should've known that the Vegas toast didn't have pico de gallo and maybe clarified that that was the correct order if she knowingly knew the Vegas toast had no pico.  When I tried to tell her I meant the Dirty Fork Lunch Special she said "no problem let me try to alter it".  THEN shortly came back and said she couldn't alter it and they would make the correct one.  THEN she came back again and told me I would get charged for both plates.    It's disappointing when you go to a business when they first open & then they start to be "cheap" & not accommodate.  The owner has even recognized me the first 3 times prior.  I liked going here because the food was decent and close by to work.  They're over priced for the amount of food you get, I won't be coming back.  Take care of your customers & customer service determines if people will come back.  Which from the looks of it you guys have lost a few people from your service.

bj4RCCsUnISV4fRDJMuesw.text: First time visit, saw a great menu and was excited to try it out with family. We put in the order, finally get water about 20 more minutes after. After deciding it was too hot to dine in, we asked for the order to go. Once we got home ready to eat, we realize 2/5 of the orders we got were correct, and we were missing 2 others. Out of 7 different orders, two were correct. We called and mentioned the missing items and they responded indifferently saying it'll be ready in 10, with no apology. Definitely won't be returning.

L6nPIQUkvF1-B_SbAvSIdg.text: Rolled in here on a Sunday morning around 10am. Prime breakfast time, but fortunately no line here. In fact, only about 3 tables were filled. That had me a little bit worried.  It's a small place, maybe 15 or so tables. Very clean and well decorated. My friend and I sat down and ordered our drinks, coffee for me and water for him. Both of these cups were never empty. They even bring a fancy bottle with water for your table...nice touch!  Service was excellent. Maybe because it wasn't crowded, but our server took his time and let us check out the menu, answered all questions with accuracy and knowledge, and did a great job. No complaint here.  On to the food. I had the 9th island French Toast, my friend the Dirty Fork breakfast special, which was chicken and eggs on top of french toast. Both were well cooked, and delicious. Coconut, passionfruit or guava syrup. Very enjoyable meal!  I'd come back, as would my friend. Prices were very fair, I think $11.95 for the French Toast.

NicXRxMTl2w3VYCNeExMag.text: Who turns the lights off when people are still eating? Pushy much? Nothing special about this place. Plus their social media person or "bot" is awfully annoying keep spamming my page with "following and unfollowing" had to block them it got THAT weird.

0Sq5l8YxqRKi6sJyu6g9qQ.text: It was finally time to try out this place, as I tour local restaurants for brunch. We ordered their Paris panini breakfast for our entree and the 9th island French toast for dessert.  As we're waiting, I had to ask the server to refill my drink; that's a pet peeve of mine. She comes back with the French toast. I pause because I was about to remind her, but I just couldn't hold it. She responded with, "oh, sorry. Well, it's gonna get busy, so this is better". In disbelief of her response, I just nod and start serving myself (apparently I'm in a rush!?).  She comes back with my drink and the panini. I set aside the French toast and start with the salad. The dressing was really good. The panini was good, but nothing special. By the time I got to the French toast, it was cold. And you know how sad French toast is. Any way, I don't think I'll be having a repeat visit.  Now, if you're down for diner-like venues, like Hawaii faire, and wanna try something new, in the area? You can try it out. If you want ono Hawaiian brunch, there's always Cinnamon's.
